receive the faith under queen Candaces in who time the family of Gaspar begin to reign and flourish in Ethiopia and from he after thirteen generation come John call the holy this man about the time of constantinus the emperor because he have no child leave the kingdom to his brother Caius elder son invest baltasar and Melchior young brother one in the kingdom of Fatigar and the other in Giomedi whereupon the royal blood grow to be divide into three family namely that of Baltafar that of Gaspar and the three of Melchior ordain that the empire above all other shall be give by election to some one of the foresay family so it be not to the elder bear for these first bear there be particular kingdom appoint and to avoid scandal and tumult he decree that the emperor brother with his near kindred shall be enclose as in a strong castle within * * * * * * * * * * * * * * of this mountain read in the discourse before the begin of leo. mount where he will also have the emperor son to be put who can succeed in the empire nor have any state at all for which cause the emperor ordinary marry not his force both in revenue and people he have two kind of revenue for one consist in the fruit of his possession which he cause to be manure by his slave and ox these slave multiply continual for they marry among themselves and their son remain in the condition of their progenitor another great revenue come of his tribute which be bring unto he from all those that hold dominion under he and of these some give horse some ox some gold some cotton and other other thing it be think he have great treasure as well of clothes and jewel as of gold and also that he have treasury and large magazine of the same riches so that write once to the king of Portugal he offer to give for the maintenance of war against the infidel a hundred thousand dram of gold with infinite store of man and victual they say that he put ordinary every year into the castle of the value of three million of ducat it be true that before the day of king Alexander they lay not up so much gold because they know not how to purify it but rather jewel and wedge of gold also his commings-in may be say to be of three sort for some he raise as it be out of his crowne-lande another part he levy of the people that pay he so much for a house and the ten of all those mine that be dig by other then by himself and a three revenue he draw from his tributary prince and governor and these give he the entire revenue of one of their city so as he choose not that city wherein they make their residence but though his wealth and revenue be great yet be his people of little worth as well because he hold they in the estimation of slave by mean whereof they want that generosity of mind which make man ready to take up arm and to be courageous in danger as also it seem they have ever their hand bind with that awful reverence which they bear towards their prince and the fear they have of he and further in that they have no arm of defence but bad headpiece half skull and coat of mail carry thither by the portugal hereunto may be add his want of fortress for neither have strong place whither to retire nor arm to defend themselves they and their town remain as a pray to the enemy their offensive arm be unfeathered arrow and some dart they have a lend of fifty day continuance which through the great abstinence wherein they pass all that time do so weaken and afflict they that neither for those day nor many other follow they have the strength to stir abroad whereupon the moor attend this opportunity and assail they with great advantage Francis Aluares write that Prete janni can bring into the field a hundred thousand man nevertheless in time of need it have be see that he can make nothing so many he have a military religion or order of knighthood under the protection of saint (@) whereunto every noble man must ordain one of every three male child but not the elder and out of these be constitute twelve thousand knight or gentleman for the king guard the end of this order be to defend the confine of the empire and to make head against the enemy of the faith prince confine upon the Prete janni this prince as far as we can certain understand confine especial with three other mighty prince one be the king of Borno another the great Turk and the three the king of adel. the king of Buruo rule over that country which extend from Guangara towards the east about five hundred mile between the desert of and barca be of a uneeven situation because it be partly mountainous and partly plain in the plain there dwell a very civil people in populous and much frequent village by reason of the abundance of grain as also there be some concourse of merchant thither on the mountain shepherd of great and small beast do inhabit and their chief sustenance be mill they lead a brutish life without religion with their wife and child in common they use no other proper name but those which be take from the quality or form of man person the lame the squint eye the long the stutter this king of Borno be most mighty in man upon who he lay no other imposition but the ten of their fruit their profession be to rob and steal from their neighbour and to make they slave in exchange of who they have of the merchant of Barbary horse he have under he many kingdom and people partly white and partly black he molest the abassine exceed with theft lead away their cattle rob their mine and make their man slave they fight on (@) back after the gynnet fashion they use lance with two head and dart and arrow they assail a country sometime in one part and otherwhiles in another sudden but these may rather be term thief and robber then right enemy the Turk confine with Abassia on the east as likewise the king of adel who hem it in between the east and the south they disturb the Prete exceed restrain the limit of his empire and bring his country into great misery for the turk beside the put of a great part of Barnagasso to sack and spoil upon which they enter the year of our lord 1558. although they be drive out again have further take all that from the Prete which he possess on the sea coast especial the port and town of Suaquen and Ercoco in which two place the mountain lie betwixt Abassia and the red sea do open and make a passage for conveyance of victual and traffic between the abassin and the arabian and it be not long since the lord Barnagasso be constrain to accord with the Turk and to buy the peace of his country with the tribute of a thousand ounce of gold by the year also the king of adel procure he no less molestation this man confine with the kingdom of Fatigar and extend his dominion even to the red sea where he have Assum Salir Meth Barbora Pidar and Zeila at Barbora many ship of aden and Cambaia arrive with their merchandise for exchange from whence they receive much flesh honey wax and victual for aden and gold ivory and other thing for Cambaia a great quantity of victual be carry from Zeila because there be abundance of wax and honey with corn and diverse fruit which be lade for aden and for Arabia and beast also as namely sheep with tail weigh more than five and twenty pound with their head and neck all black but the rest of they be white as also certain other all white with tail a fathom long and writhe like a vine branch have thropple under their throat like bull there be also certain kine with branch horn like to wild heart be black in colour and sorne other red with one only horn upon their forehead of a handful and a half long turn backward the chief city of this kingdom be Arar eight and thirty league from Zeila towards the south east this king be a mahometan by a perpetual profession of make war against the christian of Abassia who be the subject of the Prete have obtain of those barbarian the surname of holy he stay his oportunitie while the abassin be weaken and bring down with that long and hard fast of fifty day when they can scarce go about their domestical affair and then he enter into the country sack the town lead the people away into servitude and do a thousand injury unto they the Abassin slave be of great value out of their own country whereupon the border and other prince both far and near esteem they much and many of they by mean of their industry in service of slave have become captain and great commander in Arabia Cambaia Bengala and sumatra because the mahometan prince of the east be all tyrant over kingdom usurp from the gentile for security of their state put no trust in their own subject but arm themselves with a multitude of strange slave to who they commit their person and the government of their kingdom and among all other slave the abassine bear away the bell aswell for fidelity as for sound and good complexion and because the king of adel with the multitude of these Abassin slave which he take in the town and territory of Prete janni fill all Egypt and Arabia in exchange of who he have armour munition and soldier both from the Turk and the arabian prince in the year of our lord 1550. Claudius king of Abassia be after this sort sore oppress by gradaamed king of adel who now for the space of fowerteene year have with continual incursion grievous molest and disturb he enforce he to leave his confine and to retire into the hart of his empire demand aid of Stephano gama the indian viceroy of John the three king of Portugal who be then with a good fleet upon the red sea whereupon he send he four hundred portugal with a good quantity of arm and small shot under the government of Christopher da gama his brother with these man by the benefit of shot he overthrow the enemy in two battle but in the three the king of adel have receive a thousand turkish harquebuzier from the governor of Zebit with ten piece of artillery the abassin be put to (@) and discomfit and their captain take prisoner and put (@) death but the king of adel afterward send back the say turk he and his people be sudden assail near the river of Zeila and mount saval by king Claudius with threescore thousand foot and five hundred Abassin horse together with those portugal who remain of the former overthrow one of who wound gradame dangerous but in the month of march the year of our lord 1559. king Claudius be set upon again by the Malacai mores he be slay in the battle and the enimie-king acknowledge so great a victory from the hand of God triumph upon a ass Adamas brother unto king Claudius succeed he against who for he be half a mahometan the best part of the abassine nobility rebel and he be defeat by the Barnagasso in the year 1562. who have thus for a while disturb the affair of Ethiopia it seem that they be at length assuage and reestablish under Alexander by the aid of the portugal who have carry thither arm as well of offence as defence and stir up the mind and courage of the abassine by their example to war for all those that remain of the discomfiture give to Christopher gama and diverse other which come thither afterward and do daily there arrive and stay do marry wife and have child and Alexander permit they to elect a judge who may execute justice among they so that they have and do daily bring into Abassia the manner of warfare in Europe with our use of arm and the manner of fortify passage and place of importance afterward certain florentine go into those country partly upon pleasure and partly for affair of merchandise for Francisco Medici great duke of Florence have some commerce with the abassine the Prete therefore give entertainment and make much of the Frankes for so do they call the people of Europe and hardly give they licence to depart out of his kingdom beside these the Prete janni have diverse other enemy among who be the king of Dancali to who the town and port of Vela upon the red sea pertain he confine with Balgada the moor also vex he great which inhabit the province call doba divide into fowerteene signiory for though they be within the confine of Prete janni his empire yet notwithstanding for the most part they rebel from he they have a law that none of they may marry before he first give testimonial that he have slay twelve christian of the emperor of Monomotapa concern the state of this mighty emperor and of his neighbour of Mohenemugi and of the limit of both their dominion as likewise of the amazon and Giacchi the chief strength of their military force and other memorable matter to avoid tedious repetition I refer the reader to the discourse go before the book save only that I will here annex a brief testimony out of Osorius lib 4 reb gest Eman. which may add some small light unto the treatise before mention but say he in this part of Ethiopia lie beyond the cape of good hope which be bound by the south ocean there be a most ample kingdom call Benomotapa whereunto before such time as the portugal discover those part all the king upon that coast be most obedient subject it abound with gold beyond all credit which be take even out (@) most (@) in gold of their river and lake yea many king there be which pay yearly tribute of gold unto this king of Benomotapa the people worship no idol but acknowledge one god the creator of heaven and earth in habit and apparel they be not much unlike to other ethiopian they worship their king with wonder superstition this king in his scutcheon or coat of the king arm arm have two sign of majesty one be a certain little spade with a handle of ivory the other be two small dart by the spade he (@) his subject to husbandry that they may not through sloth and negligence let the earth lie untilled and so for want be constrain to play the thief the one of his dart betoken that he will be a severe punisher of malefactor and the other that he will by valour and force of arm resist all foreign invasion the son of his tributary king be train up in his court a (@) course both to the end that by this education they may learn loyalty and love towards he their sovereign and also that they may remain as pledge to keep their father in awe and due obedience he be continual guard with a mighty army notwithstanding he be conjoin in most firm league with all his neighbour-prince for by this mean he suppose that war can procure he any danger at all know right well that oftentimes in the midst of peace it be ready to disturb the security of prince every year this king send certain of his courtier and servant to bestow a recrely (@) (@) (@) of (@) fire from the (@) to his (@) prince in his name new fire upon all the prince and king within his dominion that from they it may be distribute unto other also which be do in manner follow the messenger be come to the house of any prince his fire be immediate quench then be there a new fire kindle by the messenger and forthwith all the neighbour resort thither to fetch of the say new fire for their house which whosoever refuse to perform be hold as a traitorous rebel and receive such punishment as be liable to high treason yea if need be a army be levy to apprehend (@) to the end that be take he may be put to such torment as be correspondent to his disloyalty hitherto Osorius the Xeriffo common call the king of Maroco (@) and Fez. among all the prince of Africa I suppose that there be not any one who in richness of state or greatness of power may be prefer before the Xeriffo in that his dominion which comprehend all that part of Mauritania call by the roman Tingitana extend itself north and south from Capo boiador even to Tanger and east and west from the atlantic ocean as far as the river Muluia and somewhat further also in which space be comprehend the fair fruitful best inhabit and most civil part of all africa and among other the state the most famous kingdom of Maroco and Fez. with the particular description whereof and of all the province city town river mountain etc. therein contain the reader may satisfy himself to the full in the second and three book of the history of John Leo before set down these kingdom beside their natural fertility be very traffickable for though the king of Fez have no haven of importance upon the mediterranean sea nevertheless the english french and other nation traffic much to his port upon the ocean especial to * * * * * * * * * * * * * * describe by Leo in his five book under the name of Lharais cruz cabo de Guer and in other place pertain partly to the kingdom of Fez and partly to Maroco and they bring thither copper and brass with arm and diverse commodity of Europe for which among other thing they return sugar but because these kingdom of Maroco and Fez and diverse other signiory and principality at first separate and divide be unite not long sithence under one prince who be call * * * * or Miramonin the Xeriffo it will not be much from our purpose because among the accident of our time I think there be not any one more notable or wonderful than this to set down here how the matter pass about the year of our lord 1508 a certain alchaide bear in the manner how the Xeriffos aspire to the kingdom of Maroco Sus and Fez. a town of dara who name be Mahumet Benametto and who cause himself to be call Xeriffo be a subtle man and of a mind no less ambitious then learned in those science whereunto the mahometan be most addict begin to grow famous in the town of Numidia this man vaunt himself to be descend of mahumets progeny be possess with a imagination trust in the division of the state of Africa wherein then the portugal bear great sway of take into his own hand all * * * * * * * * * or the kingdom of Maroco and Fez. Mauritania Tingitana for performance of this he first send his three (@) Abdel Abnet and Mahumet in pilgrimage to Mecca and Medina there to visit and do reverence to the sepulchre of their seductor Mahumet the young man perform this voyage with so great fame and reputation of sanctity and religion if these word may be use in declare of such a impiety that in their return the people come out to meet they kiss their garment and reverence they as saint they feign themselves to be ravish into deep contemplation go up and down the street sigh and cry out in word interrupt with lamentation and yearn Ala and they live of nothing but alm their father have take they home with great mirth and joy but yet not mind to suffer this sudden applause and credit which they have obtain by such a pilgrimage to freeze and wax cold he send two of they which be * * * * or Abnet and Mahumet to Fez where be courteous receive by the king one of they become a reader in the a most famous college of that city and the the young be make tutor to the same king young son these two see themselves so entire belove of the king and in so great favour with the people be advise by their father and take occasion upon the damage which the arabian and moor do to those of their own law and sect under the ensign of the portugal in who pay they serve they demand leave of the king to display a (@) against the christian put he in hope as indeed it fall out that they will easy draw those moor unto he who be follower of the crown of Portugal and by this mean secure the province of Sus Hea Ducala Maroco with other molest and evil entreat by the portugal this request be contradict by nazer brother to the king for say he if these man under pretence of holiness and defence of their law shall have some prosperous proceed with arm in hand it will not afterward be in thy power o king to bridle or bring they down for arm make man courageous and by victory they prove insolent and the rout of ambitious people be always desirous of innovation but the king who have a great opinion of their sanctity make small account of the reason his brother allege unto he give they a banner and drumslade and twenty horse to accompany they with letter of recommendation to the arabian the prince and the city of Barbary with these beginning many people run headlong after their fame they overcome Ducala and the country of * * * * or Azaphi Saphia and go forward even as far as cabo de Guer which place then be subject to the portugal and find themselves strong both in retinue and credit they demand of the people who at that time live for the most part free and come in to none but such as they like of themselves that see they now take up arm for the mahumetane law against the christian they shall aid they with their ten due unto God the which be present yield unto they by the people of dara and so they seize by little and little upon tarodant where their father be make governor and likewise of Sus Hea Ducala and other place adjoin they first plant themselves in tedn and then in tesarote and in a conflict (@) Lopes barriga a famous captain among the portugal but so they lose their own elder brother therein and afterward by fair word enter into the (@) of Maroco they poison the king and in his stead make Xeriffo to be proclaim king of Maroco in the mean while the arabian of Ducala and come to hand blow with those of Garbia each party hold themselves in the xeriffoe favour but the Xeriffos perceive the skirmish to grow hot and that many both of the one and of the other party go to wrack turn their arm against they both and enrich themselves with their spoil in former time they use to send unto the king of Fez the five of all those booty which they get but after this victory make no reckon of their say custom they present he only with six horse and six camel and those but silly one whereat be move he send to demand of they the five part of their spoil and the tribute that the king of Maroco pay he threaten otherwise war upon they but in the mean while this man die his son who be scholar to the young Xeriffo be not only content but further confirm in the signiory of Maroco so that in some small matter he will acknowledge the king of Fez for sovereign prince over that city but on the other side the xeriffi who reputation and power daily increase when the time of pay tribute come send to certify this young king that be lawful successor to Mahumet they be not bind to pay tribute to any and that they have more right to Africa than he so that if he will have they his friend so it be otherwise if he mean to divert they from this their war against the christian they shall not want courage nor power to defend themselves wherewith the Fessan king be offend proclaim war against they and go himself in person to the siege of Maroco but at the very first he be drive to dislodge and afterward return with eighteen thousand horse among who be two thousand harquebuzier or bowman he be vanquish by the xeriffi who have no more but seven thousand horse and twelve hundred harquebuzier which be place on the way at the passage of a river by mean of this victory the Xeriffi shake off the tribute of that country and pass over Atlas they take tafilete a important city and partly by fair mean partly by force they bring diuers people of Numidia to their obedience as also those of the mountain in the year of our lord 1536. the young Xeriffo who be now call king of Sus have gather together a mighty army and much artillery take in part from the king of Fez and partly artillery cast by french renegado cast by the french renegado he go to the enterprise of cabo de Guer a very important fortification hold then by the portugal which be build and fortify first at the charge of Lopes Sequeira and afterward know their opportunity from the king don Emanuel there be fight on both side a most terrible battle in the end fire take hold on the munition and upon this the soldier be daunt that defend the fortress the Xeriffo enter thereinto take the town and make the great part of the garrison his prisoner by this victory the xeriffi bring in a manner all Atlas and the kingdom of Maroco to their obedience and those arabian who serve the crown of Portugal whereupon king John the three see that his expense far exceed the revenue which come in of his own accord give over Safia Azamor Arzilla and Alcazar hold which he have on the coast of Mauritania this (@) be a occasion of grievous discord betwixt the brother the issue whereof be that the young have in two battle subdue the elder whereof the second be in the year of our lord 1554 and take he prisoner he banish he to Tafilet and afterward turn his arm against the king of Fez after have take he once prisoner and then release he he yet the second time because he break promise get he into his hand again deprive he of his estate and in the end cause both he and his son to be slay and by mean of his own son he also take tremizen in the mean while araes viceroy of Algiers fear the Xeriffos prosperous success gather together a great army with which he first recover tremizen and afterward defeat the Xeriffo conquer Fez and give the government thereof to Buasson prince of Veles but this man join battle with the Xeriffo lose at one instant both his city and kingdom in the end Mahumet go to tarodant be upon the way slay in his pavilion by the treason of some turk suborn thereunto by the viceroy of Algiers of who one assen be the chief who together with his companion go into tarodant and there make havoc of the king treasure but in their return home they be all but five slay by the people in the year 1559 and Abdala the Xeriffos son be proclaim and salute king let thus much suffice to have be speak of the Xeriffo who proceed appear much like to those of Ishmael the sophy of persia. both of they procure follower by blood and the cloak of religion both of they subdue in short time many country both of they grow great by the ruin of their neighbour both of they receive grievous check by the turk and lose a part of their state for Selym take from Ishmael Cacamit and diverse other city of Diarbena and the viceroy of Algiers do drive the Xeriffo out of tremizen and his other quarter and even as Selim win Tauris the head city of Persia and afterwards give it over so araes take Fez the head city of Mauritania and then after abandon the same the Xeriffo his revenue or come in the Xeriffo be absolute lord of all his subject good yea and of their person also for though he charge they with never so burdensome tribute and imposition yet dare they not so much as open their mouth he receive from his tributary vassal the ten and first fruit of their corn and cattle true it be that for the first fruit he take no more but one for twenty and the whole be above twenty he demand no more than two though it amount to a hundred for every day tilth of ground he have a ducat and a quarter and so much likewise for every house as also he have after the same rate of every person above fifteen year old male or female and when need require a great sum and to the end that the people may the more cheerful pay that which be impose upon they he always demand half as much more as he be to receive most true it be that on the mountain there inhabit certain fierce and vatamed people who by reason of the steep craggy and inexpugnable situation of their country can be force to tribute that which be get of they be the ten of their corn and fruit only that they may be permit to have recourse into the plain beside these revenue the king have the toll and custom of Fez and of other city for at the enter of their good the natural citizen pay two in the hundred and the stranger ten he have further the revenue of mill and many other thing the carwen the principal mahometan temple in Fez be a mile and a (@) about read Leo lib. 3. sum whereof be very great for the mill yield he little less than half a royal of plate for every Hanega of corn that be ground in Fez where as they say there be above four hundred mill the moschea of carwen have fourscore thousand ducat of rent the college and hospital of Fez have also many thousand all which the king have at this present and further he be heir to all the alcayde and they that have pension of he and at their death he possess their horse armour garment and all their good howbeit if the decease leave any son apt for the service of the war he grant they their father provision but if they be but young he bring up the male child to year of service and the daughter till they be marry and therefore that he may have some interest in the good of rich man he bestow upon they some government or charge with provision wherefore for fear of confiscation after death every one covet to (@) his wealth or to remove far from the court and the king sight for which cause the city of Fez come far short of her ancient glory beside his revenue have be augment of late year by mighty sum of gold which he fetch from Tombuto and Gago in the land of negro which gold according to the report of some may yearly amount to three million of ducat his force the Xeriffo have not any fortress of great importance but only upon the sea-coast as cabo de Guer and Tetuan for as the turk and persian do so he place the strength of his state in arm man but especial in horse and for this cause he stand not much upon his artillery although he have very great store which his predecessor take from the portugal and other in Fez Maroco Tarodant and in the foresay (@) cause also more to be cast when need require for he want not master of Europe in this science he have a house of munition in Maroco where they make ordinary six and forty quintal of powder every month as likewise also caliver and steele-bowe in the year of our lord 1569. a fire take hold on these house with such fury that a great part of the city be destroy therewith but for the xeriffoe force they be of two sort the first be of two thousand seven hundred horse and two thousand harquibuzier which he have partly in Fez but most in Maroco where he be resident be as it be of his daily guard the second be of a royal squadron of six thousand gentleman be all of noble parentage and of great account these man be mount upon excellent horse with furniture and arm for variety of colour most beautiful and for riches of ornament beyond measure estimable for every thing about they shine with gold silver pearl jewel and whatsoever else may please the eye or satisfy the curiosity of beholder these man beside provision of corn oil butter and flesh for themselves their wife child and servant receive further in wage from seventy to a hundred ounce of silver a man the three sort of force which he have consist of his * Timariotti these be a military order like unto they which hold land (@) we under the (@) of knight service for the Xeriffo grant to all his son and brother and other person of account or authority among the people of Africa or to the prince of the arabian the benefit of great lordship and tenor for sustentation of his cavallarie and the alchaide themselves till the field and afterwards reap rice oil barley butter sheep hen and money and distribute the same monthly to the soldier according to the several quality of their person they also give they cloth linen and silk to apparel themselves arm of offence and defence and horse with which they serve in the war and if they die or be kill they allow they other a thing which be also use in Rome towards they that serve on public horse every one of these leader contend to bring his people into the field well order for arm apparel and horse beside this they have between four and twenty and thirty ounce of silver wage every year his four military force be the arabian who live continual in their for so they call their habitation each one of they consist of a hundred or two hundred (@) govern by diverse alchaide to the end they may be ready in time of need these serve on horseback but they be rather to be account thief then true soldier his five kind of force military be somewhat like unto the train soldier of christian prince and among these the inhabitant of city and village of the kingdom and of the mountain be enrol it be true that the king make but little account of they and very seldom put arm into their hand for fear of insurrection and rebellion except in the war against the christian for than he can convenient forbid they for it be write in their law that if Moor kill a Christian or be slay by he he go direct into paradise a diabolical invention man woman and those of every age and degree run to the war hand over head that at least they may there be slay and by this mean according to their foolish opinion gain heaven no less zeal to our confusion may we perceive in the turk especial for defence of their sect for one will think they go to a marriage and not to the war scarce be able with patience to attend their prefix time of go thither they repute they holy and happy that die with arm in hand against their enemy as on the contrary those man unhappy and of little worth that die at home amid the lamentation of child and outcry of woman by the thing above set down we may easy comprehend what number of man the Xeriffo can bring into the field but yet we may learn better by experience for Abdala in the year 1562. besiege mazagan with two hundred thousand man choke the ditch with a mountain of earth and beat down the wall thereof with his artillery but for all this he be enforce by the valour of the portugal and the damage which he receive by their mine to give over his siege beside this prince can not continue a great war above two or three month and the reason hereof be because his force live on that provision which he have daily come in as well for sustenance as for apparel and not be able to have all this conduct thither where the war require it follow of necessity that in short time they must needs return home for their maintenance of life and further it be a evident thing that no man can protract a war at length except he be rich in treasure Molucco who overthrow Sebastian king of Portugal have in pay under his ensign forty thousand horse and eight thousand foot beside arabian and adventurer but it be think he can have bring into the field seventy thousand horse and more foot than he do of the dominion and fortress which the king of Spain have upon the isle and main land of Africa and of the great quantity of treasure and other commodity which be bring from thence beside oran Mersalquibir Melilla and pennon which the king of Spain possess within the straits as likewise Tanger and Arzil which by the title of Portugal he hold very near the straits of Gibraltar and mazagan in like sort without the straits mouth twenty mile to the southward of Arzil he have along the coast of Africa from cape de Guer to that of Guardafu two sort of state for some be immedidiate under he and other be as it be his adherent the land of madera puerto santo the canary the isle of Arguin of cabo Verde the isle with that of Sant Thomas and other near adjoin be immediate under his dominion these island be maintain with their own victual and provision and yet they have also some out of Europe as in like manner they send some thither especial sugar and fruit wherewith the isle of madera wonderful abound as also with wine and the island of Sant Thomas likewise have great abundance of sugar these state have no encumbrance but by the english and french man of war * * * * * * * * * my author here much mistake the matter which for all that go not beyond cape Verde at the island of Arguin and at Sant George de la mina the portugal have plant factory in form of fortress by mean of which they trade with the border people of Guinie and Libya and get into their hand the gold of Mandinga and other place near about among the adherent prince the rich and most honourable be the king of congo in that his kingdom be one of the most flourish and plentiful country in all Ethiopia the portugal have there two colony one in the city of s. Saluador and a other in the island Loanda they have diverse rich commodity from this kingdom but the most important be every year about 5000. slave which they transport from thence and sell they at good round prize in all the isle and main land of the west indies and for the head of every slave so take up there be a good tax pay to the crown of Portugal from this kingdom one may easy go to the country of Prete janni for it be not think to be very far off and it do so abound with elephant victual and all other necessary thing as will bring singular ease and commodity to such a enterprise upon the kingdom of congo confine angola with who prince of late year Paulo Dias a Portugal captain make war and the principal occasion of this war be certain mine of silver in the mountain of cabambe no whit inferior to those of Potossi but by so much be they better as fine silver go beyond that which be base and course and out of doubt if the portugal have esteem so well of thing near at hand as they do of those far off and remote and have thither bend their force wherewith they pass Capo and go to India malaca and the malucoe they have more easy and with less charge find great wealth for there be no country in the world rich in gold and silver than the kingdom of Mandinga Ethiopia congo angola butua Toroa Maticuo Boro Monomotapa Cafati and but human avarice esteem more of a other man than his own and thing remote appear great than those near at hand between cabo and cape Guardafu the portugal have the fortress of Sena Cephala and mozambique and by these they continue master of the trade with the border nation all which abound in gold and ivory by these fortress they have special commodity for their navigation to the indies because their fleet sometime winter and otherwhiles victual and refresh themselves there in these part the king of Melinde be their great friend and those of Quiloa and other neighbour-island be their tributary the portugal want nothing but man for beside other island which they leave in a manner abandon there be that of saint Laurence one of the great in all the world be a thousand two hundred mile long and four hundred and fower-score broad the which though it be not well till yet for the goodness of the soil it be apt and fit to be manure nature have distinguish it with river harbour and most commodious bay these state belong to the crown of Portugal fear no other but such sea-force as may be bring thither by the turk but the daily go to and fro of the Portugal fleet which coast along up and down those sea altogether secure they in the year 1589. they take near unto Mombaza four galley and a galliot belong to the turk who be so bold as to come even thither the dominion of the great Turk in Africa the great Turk possess in Africa all the sea-coast from velez de Gumera or as some hold opinion from the river Muluia which be the eastern limit of the kingdom of Fez even to the arabian gulf or red sea except some few place as namely Mersalcabir Melilla oran and pennon which the king of Spain hold in which space before mention be situate sundry of the most famous city and kingdom in all Barbary that be to say tremizen alger tenez Bugia Constantina Tunis Tripoli and all the country of Egypt from Alexandria to the city of Asna call of old Siene together with some part of Arabia from the town of suez to that of Suachen also in Africa the grand signior have five viceroy call by the name of beglerbeg or bassa namely at alger Tunis Tripoli at missir for all Egypt and at Suachen for those place which be challenge by the great Turk in the dominion of Prete janni final in this part at suez in the bottom of the arabian gulf be one of his four principal arsenal or place for the building repair dock and harbour of his warlike galley which may lie here under covert to the number of five and twenty bottom a summary discourse of the manifold religion profess in Africa and first of the gentile AFrica contain four sort of people different in religion that be to say gentile jew mahometan and christian the gentile extend themselves along the shore of the ocean in a manner from cabo blanco or the white cape even to the northern border of congo as likewise from the southerly bound of the same kingdom even to Capo Esperanca and from thence to that and within the land they spread out from the ethiopic ocean even unto Nilus and beyond Nilus also from the ethiopic to the arabian sea these gentile be of diverse sort for some of they have no light of God or religion neither they be govern by any rule or law whereupon the arabian call they Cafri that be to say lawless or without law they have but few habitation and they live for the most part in cave of mountain or in wood wherein they find some harbour from wind and rain the civil among they who have some understanding and light of divinity and religion obey the Monomotapa who dominion extend with a great circuit from the confine of Matama to the river Cuama but the noble part thereof be comprehend between the mighty river of Magnice or Spirito Sancto and that of (@) for the space of six hundred league they have no idol and believe in one only God call by they Mozimo little differ from these we may esteem the subject of Mohenemugi but among all the Cafri the people call agag or Giacchi be repute most brutish inhabit in wood and den and be devourer of man flesh they dwell upon the left bank of Nilus between the first and second lake the Anzichi also have a shambles of man flesh as we have of the flesh of ox they eat their enemy who they take in war they sell their slave to butcher if they can light on no great prize and they inhabit from the river Zaire even to the desert of Nubia some other of they be rather addict to witchcraft then to idolatry consider that in a man the fear of a superior power be so natural that though he adore nothing under the name and title of a god yet do he reverence and fear some superiority although he know not what it be such be the Biafresi and their neighbour all of they be addict in such sort to witchcraft as that they vaunt that by force of enchantment they can not only charm and make man die much more molest and bring they to hard point but further raise wind and rain and make the sky to thunder and lighten and that they can destroy all herb and plant and make the flock and herd of cattle to fall down dead whereupon they reverence more the devil than any thing else sacrifice unto he of their beast and fruit of the earth yea their own blood also and their child such be likewise the priest of angola who they call ganghe these make profession that they have in their hand dearth and abundance fair weather and foul life and death for which cause it can not be express in what veneration they be hold among these barbarian in the year 1587. a Portugal captain be in a part of angola with his soldier a Ganga be request by the people to refresh the field which be dry and wither with some quantity of water he need no great entreaty but go forth with diverse little bell in presence of the portugal he spend a half hour in fetch suudry gambol and skip and utter diverse superstitious murmur and behold a cloud arise in the air with lightning and thunder the portugal grow amaze but all the barbarian with great joy admire and extol unto heaven their Ganga who now give out intolerable brag not know what hang over his head for the wind outrageous blow the sky thunder after a dreadful manner in stead of the rain by he promise there fall a thunderbolt which like a sword cut his head clean from his shoulder some other idolater not look much aloft worship earthly thing such be the people of congo before their conversion and be at this day those that have not yet receive the gospel for these man worship certain dragon with wing and they foolish nourish they in their house with the delicate meat that they have they worship also serpent of horrible shape goat tiger and other creature and the more they fear and reverence they by how much the more deform and monstrous they be among the number of their god also they reckon bat owl owlet tree and herb with their figure in wood and stone and they do not only worship these beast live but even their versy kin when they be dead be fill with straw or some other matter and the manner of their idolatry be to bow down before the foresay thing to cast themselves grovel upon the earth to cover their face with dust and to offer unto they of their best substance some lift up their mind a little high worship star such be the people of Guinie and their neighbour who be incline to the worship of the sun the great part of they and they hold opinion that the soul of those dead that live well mount up into heaven and there dwell perpetual near unto the sun neither want there among these certain other so superstitious as they worship for God the first thing they meet withal come out of their house they also hold their king in the account and estimation of god who they suppose to be descend from heaven and their king to maintain themselves in such high reputation be serve with wonder ceremony neither will they be see but very seldom of the jew the jew who have be disperse by god throughout the whole world to confirm we in the holy faith enter into Ethiopia in the queen of Sabas day in company of a son that Solomon have by she to the number as the abassin affirm of twelve thousand and there multiply their generation exceed in that they not only fill Abassia but spread themselves likewiseall over the neighbour province so that at this day also the abassin affirm that upon Nilus towards the west there inhaibt a most populous nation of the jewish stock under a mighty k. and some of our modern cosmographer set down a province in those quarter which they call the land of the hebrew place as it be under the equinoctial in certain unknown mountain between the confine of Abassia and congo and likewise on the north part of the kingdom of Goiame and the southerly quarter of the kingdom of gorham there be certain mountain people with jew who there maintain themselves free and absolute through the inaccessiable situation of the same for in truth by this mean the inhabitant of the mountain speak general be the most ancient and free people in that the strong situation of their native soil secure they from the incursion of foreign nation and the violence of their neighbour such be the scot in Britain and the biskaine in Spain but to return again to our purpose the Anzichi who extend from the bank of the river Zaire even to the confine of Nubia use circumcision as also diverse other border people do a thing that must necessary have be bring in by the jew and yet remain still in use after the annihilation of the mosaical law among they some also think that the people call Cafri or Cafates at this day who be gentile draw their original from the jew but be environ on every side by idolater they have by little and little swerve from the law of Moses and so be become as it be insensible idolater on the other side the jew be wonderful increase in Spain pass one after a other into Africa and Mauritania and disperse themselves even to the confine of Numidia especial by mean of traffic and the profession of goldsmith the which be utter forbid the mahometan be altogether practise among they by the jew as be likewise diverse other mechanical craft but principal that of black smith a thing which notable appear in mount in the kingdom of Maroco and in mount it be say that eitdevet a town in the kingdom of Maroco be inhabit by the jew of the stock as they affirm of David who notwithstanding by little and little be grow mahumetan the jew increase afterward in Africa when first (@) king of Spain call the catholic and after he Emanuel king of Portugal put they forth of their dominion for then many go over into the kingdom of Fez and Maroco and bring in thither the art and profession of Europe unknown before to those barbarian in Teza Elmedina Tefsa and in segelmesse every placeis full of they they pass also by way of traffic even to Tombuto although John Leo write how that king be so great their enemy that he confiscate the good of those that trade with they it import i not to speak of Egypt because it have ever be as well by reason of the neerne of Palestina as for the commodity of traffic whereunto they be much incline as it be their second country here in great number and in a manner in all the city and town thereof they exercise mechanical art and use traffic and merchandise as also take upon they the receipt of tax and custom but above all other place in Alexandria and cairo where they amount to the number of five and twenty thousand and the civil sort among they do usual speak the castilian tongue (@) much may suffice to have be speak concern the jew it now remain that we come to entreat of the mahometan of Africa concern who before we make any particular relation it will not be amiss for the reader more perfect instruction to speak somewhat in general as namely of the sinister proceed of their first seducer Mahumet of the variety and propagation of their damn sect over the east and south part of the world of the four principal nation which be the maintainer and upholder of this diabolical religion and of sundry other particular most worthy the observation of Mahumet and of his accurse religion in general MAhumet his father be a certain profane idolater call Abdala of the stock of Ishmael and his mother be one * * * * or Emina a jew both of they be of very humble and poor condition he be bear in the year of our lord 562. and be endow with a grave countenance and a quick wit be grow to man estate the arabian accustom to rob and run all over the country take he prisoner and sell he to a persian merchant who discern he to be apt and subtle about business affect and hold he in such account that after his death his mistress remain a widow scorn not to take he for her husband be therefore enrich by this mean with good and credit he raise up his mind to great matter the time then answer very fit for one that will disturb or work any innovation for the arabian upon some evil entreaty be malcontented with the emperor heraclius the heresy of arrius and Nestorius have in a miserable sort shake and annoy the church of God the jew though they want power yet amount they to a great number the saracen prevail mighty both in number and force and the roman empire be full of slave Mahumet therefore take hold on this opportunity frame a law wherein all of they shall have some part or prerogative in this two jew and two heretic assist he of which one be John be a scholar of Nestorius school and the other Sergius of the sect of arrius whereupon the principal intention of this curse law be whole aim against the divinity of our saviour jesus Christ wicked oppugn by the jew and arrian he persuade this law first by give his wife to understand and his neighbour by her mean and by little and little other also that he converse with the angel Gabriel unto who brightness he ascribe the fall sickness which many time prostrate he upon the earth dilate and amplify the same in like sort by permit all that which be plausible to sense and the flesh as also by offer liberty to all slave that will come to he and receive his law wherefore be prosecute hard by the master of those fugitive slave lead away by he he flee to Medina Talnabi and there remain some time from this flight the mahometan fetch the original of their Hegeira but questionless there be nothing that further more the enlargement of the mahometan sect than prosperitic in arm and the multitude of victory whereby Mahumet overthrow the persian become lord of Arabia and drive the roman out of Syria and his successor afterward extend their empire from Euphrates to the atlantic ocean and from the river Niger to the Pirenei mountain and beyond they occupy Sicilia assail Italy and with continual prosperity as it be for three hundred year either subdue or encumber both the east and west but to return to Mahumet his law it embrace circumcision and make a difference between meat pure and unpure partly to allure the jew it deny the divinity of Christ to reconcile the arrian who be then most mighty it foi in many frivolous fable that it may fit the gentile and lose the bridle to the flesh which be a thing acceptable to the great part of man whereupon Avicen though he be a mahometan write thus of such a law say he mahume etc. that be to say our law which Mahumet give we regard the disposition of felicity or misery according to the body but there be another promise which concern the mind or the soul which wise divine have a far great desire to apprehend then that of the body which though it be give unto they yet respect they it not nor hold it in any estimation in comparison of that felicity which be a conjunction with truth Mahumet be dead * * * * or haly. Alle abubequer Omar and Odoman his kinsman each of they pretend to be his true successor write distinct every one by himself upon which there do arise four several sect Alle be head of the sect Imemia be follow by the persian indian and many arabian and gelbine of Africa abubequer give foundation to the sect Melchia embrace general by the arabian saracen and african Omar be author of the Anefia which be on foot among the turk in Syria and in that part of africa which be call odman leave behim the Banefia or Xefaia as we may term it which want not follower among the foresay nation of these four sect in process of time grow sixty eight other very famous beside some of less renown and fame among the many mahometan sect there be the morabite who lead their life for the most part in hermitage and make profession of moral philosophy with certain principle differ from the Alcoran one of these be that morabite which certain year past show Mahumet his name imprint in his breast be do with as I suppose or some such thing raise up a great number of arabian in africa and lay siege to Tripoli where be betray by his captain he remain the turk prisoner who send his skin to the grand signior this man be in prison say to a italian slave his familiar who go to visit he I grieve at nothing but you christian who have abandon i in that the knight of Malta only send he small succour of powder and shot these morabite affirm to declare some of their foolery that when Alle fight he kill ten thousand christian with one blow of a sword and that this sword be a hundred cubit long then there be the foolish and (@) sect of Cobtini one of these show himself not many year sithence in the market place and quarter of Algiers mount on a reed with a bridle and rein of leather give the multitude to understand that upon that horse in one night he rid a hundred league and he be for this great honour and reverence in tract of time there grow among the mahometan through the vanity of their law and the incredible variety and difference of opinion great disorder for their sect be not only wicked and treacherous as we have declare but also gross and foolish those that make profession thereof to defend and maintain it be enforce to make a thousand interpretation and construction far sometime from reason and otherwhiles from the express word of Mahumet himself the Califas endeavour mighty to reform this but their provision of great importance be two for first Moavia this man flourish about the year of our lord 770 call a assembly of learned and judicial man to establish that which in their sect shall be believe and to this end he cause all the book of Mahumet and his successor to be gather together but they not agree among themselves he choose out of they six of the most learned and shut they within a house with the say write he command they that every one shall make choice of that which seem best unto he these man reduce the mahometan doctrine into six book set down the penalty of loss of life to they that shall otherwise speak or write of the law but because the arabian give their mind to philosophy in the university of Bagdet Fez Maroco and Cordova and be of pierce and subtle wit they can not but look into the foppery of their sect there be add unto this another proviso which be a statute that forbid they the study of philosophy by mean of which statute their university before most flourish have within these four hundred year daily decline at this day the sect of mahometan impiety be distinguish more through the might and power of those nation that follow they then of themselves and the principal nation be four that be to say arabian persian tartar and turk the arabian be most superstitious and zealous the persian stand more upon reason and nature the tartar hold much gentilisine and simplicity and the turk especial in Europe be most of they libertine and martialiste the arabian as they that esteem it for great glory that Mahumet be of their nation and bury in Mecca or as other think in Medina Talnabi have labour with all art and yet procure to spread their sect over the whole world in India they first prevail with preach and afterward with arm consider that seven hundred year sithence king Perimal reign in malabar they begin there to sow this cockle and to bring the gentile more easy within their net they take and at this day take their daughter to wife a matter great esteem of they by reason of these man wealth by this policy and the traffic of spice which yield they infinite profit they quick set foot and fasten it in India they build town and plant colony and the first place where they grow to a body be Calicut which of a small thing by their concourse and traffic become a mighty city they draw king perimal to their sect who at their persuasion resolve to go and end his day at Mecca and for that purpose he put himself onward on the voyage with certain ship lade with pepper and other precious commodity but a terrible tempest meet he in the midst of his course and drown he in the sea they inhabit in malabar where two sort of arabian or moor as we may term they have more exceed increase and prevail then in any other part of the indies one be of stranger that arrive there by reason of the traffic of Arabia Cambaia and Persia and the other be those that daily be bear of a (@) father and a mother Gentile or both of father and mother moores and these who be call and differ from the other people in person custom and habit make as it be a four part of the inhabitant of that country from malabar they go to the maldive and Zeilan here they begin to take upon they the manage of the custom and imposition of city and town and by make they great than in time past they attain to the grace and favour of the prince and lord together with great reputation and authority yea preeminence and superiority over the common people and favour those who embrace their sect daily preach and divulge by the papassi but hold their hand heavy over such as show themselves repugnant they incredible advance mahumetism afterward perceive themselves strong and mighty both in richesse and follower they seize on the town and city so that at this day they command a good part of the and the port of the most noble island of Zeilan except that of Columbo where the portugal have a fortress by like stratagem be they become master of the west part of (@) within little (@) than these two hundred year first prevail by trade and commerce then by marriage and affinity and last of all by arm from hence go forward they have take into their hand the great part of the port of that large Archipelago of the lucone etc. they be lord of the city of Sunda in the great java they enjoy the great part of the land of Banda and Maluco they reign in Burneo and Gilolo they come once as far as Lucon a most noble island and one of the and have plant therein three colony on the other side they conquer upon the firm land first the rich kingdom of Cambaia and there establish their sect as they do the like in all the place adjoin from hence they go to Bengala and become lord thereof they cut off by little and little from the crown of siam the state of malaca which the portugal hold at this day as likewise those of jor and Pam and more than two hundred league along the coast final they be enter into the most ample kingdom of China and have build Moscheas in the same and if the portugal in India and the Malucos and afterward the spaniard in the have not meet they on the way and with the gospel and arm interrupt their course they will at this instant have possess infinite kingdom of the east yea in this they be so industrious and bold to our confusion that even the arabian mariner that go in the Portugal ship will tarry behind in the gentile-towne thereto publish their sect and in the year 1555. one of these man have pass even as far as japon for this purpose so that if the portugal have not remedy it in due time he will peradventure have wrought there some alteration the persian nation as touch their sect a little before our time have be make renown among those barbarous people by the valour and arm of Ishmael call the sophi this man account himself to be of the race and blood of all bring his own sect into credit and reputation and wage war against those borderer who will not accept of it he wear a red turban with twelve point or corner in memorial of the twelve son of Ocen the son of awl will that all his follower shall wear the like and many people come in unto he and in a manner all those nation which inhabit between the river Euphrates and abianus and between the caspian sea and the persian gulf tammas his son send the say twelue-cornered turban to the mahometan prince of malabar and Decan persuade they to receive it with his sect and bestow the title of a king on whomesoever will accept of it but no other receive it save Nizzamaluco it be a common voice and opinion that the great part of the mahometan of Syria and the lesser Asia follow and affect inward the sect of Alle and of the persian the which the turk perceive in the uproar of Techelle make a mighty slaughter of they carry the kinsman of the slay and those suspect out of Asia into Europe but now let we pass to the tartar these * as otherwhiles we declare g. b. b. rel. part. 1. lib. 2. dell' Asia descend of the ten tribe of Israel be transport by the order and commission of Salmanazar king of the assyrian beyond India into the of (@) here degenerate into rude and barbarous custom and forget in a great part or altogether the moysaicall ceremony they hardly retain circumcision they come out of this their banishment in the year of our lord 1200. and in a small time with the ruin of infinite nation make themselves terrible to all the east and no less to the north pope innocent the four be amaze at the horrible storm that hang over the head of Christendom for they have spread themselves like locust with this friar Ascelline be send johannes de plano who voyage be put down in the first volume of the (@) voyage even to the bank of Danubius send from the council of lion friar Ascellino of the order of dominicus with other friar to the great CAN in the year 1246. to exhort he to embrace the name and faith of Christ or at least to let the christian alone in peace of baptism he accept not but promise a league with the christian for five year other notwithstanding will needs have it that he be convert and that take up arm in favour of the christian he cause Mustaceno the Califa of Baldach to die with famine amid the treasure heap up by he but afterward either he or his successor together with his people deny their christianity become mahumetan in religion and sithence that time the tartarian name and fame grow obscure that of the turk begin to flourish the tartar Petegorski notwithstanding upon the mountain of Cumania remain firm in the christian faith but yet corrupt with the error of the greek and moscovite the colmugineere the caspian sea continue in paganism who be term Capigliati because they shave not off their hair as the other tartarsdo the Kirgessi also be idolater as otherwhiles we declare the other tartar that be come on this side of imaus have all from one to a other embrace Mahumetisme and among other the Zagatai who through the emulation they have with the persian upon who they border and contend for empire as concern sect follow the opinion of the turk as also the Mogores their descendant who in these our day have enlarge their empire between mount Caucasus and the ocean and between Ganges and Indus but the tartar of Cataya resident beyond imaus and upon the desert call lop remain general in idolatry although there continue many christian among they of the sect of Nestorius neither want there some mahometan now let we come to the turk who in largeness of empire be superior to the other sect of these part inhabit in Asia part in Europe those of Asia incline much to the opinion of the persian and especial they that inhabit in Anatolia and the border but those of Europe be general less superstitious than the asian and by reason of their daily conversation with christian they have a deep opinion and conceit of Christ then the other yea and many of they hold he for God and redeemer and it be not long sithence there be diverse put to death in Constantinople with special constancy on their part and it be think that many of the grand (@) court hold the same opinion the turk especial those of Europe be of two sort for some be natural turk other accessory or accidental natural I term they that be bear of turkish parent and they I call accidental who leave our sacred faith or the moysaicall law become mahumetan the which the christian perform by circumcise themselves and the jew by lift up a finger now the christian become turk partly upon some extreme and violent passion Cherseogli who afterward be great with bazai turn Turk to be revenge of his father who take from he his wife amid the solemnity of the marriage or Olouchali Vlucciali deny the faith to be revenge of a slave his companion in the galley who call he scald pate some abjure the faith to release themselves of torment and cruelty other for hope of honour and temporal greatness and of these two sort there be a great number in Constantinople be think to be christian in hart and yet through slothfulness or first to gather together more wealth or expect opportunity to carry with they their wife and child or for fear of be discover in their departure and voyage or else through sensuality and for that they will not be deprive of the licentiousness and (@) of the life they lead resolve not to perform that they be bind unto defer thus from month to month and from year to year to leave this Babylon and sink of sin but the great part of renegado become mahumetan without perceive it in that the grand signior send every four year more or less according as need require to take through his state of Europe of every three Christian male child one at the discretion of his commissary by way of tribute and they take they from the age of ten to the year of seventeen these be bring to Constantinople be without other ceremony circumcise and part of they be send into Anatolia and Caramania to learn the tongue religion and fashion of the turk and part be employ about the service of the seraglio or palace of Constantinople pera and Andrinople here live among the turk far from their parent separate from all conversation with the faithful and deprive of all spiritual aid and help without perceive it they be make turk the author of this the most diabolical institution that ever be make be a certain turkish saint call (@) as in the day of Amurath the second and in the begin the number be but three thousand and afterward they exceed not twelve thousand until the time of Amurath the three who increase they to the number of four and twenty thousand but return to their education after some time they be call home again to the seraglio of the zamoglans for so be they term till they be enrol among the janissary to remain there under their head and governor and in short time they become janissary or spahy and either they go to the war or be bestow in some garrison or else be resident in the court of the Turk they be call the son of the grand signior they live with great licence and liberty they do whatsoever please themselves neither can they be judge by any but the agae during their life they be seldontimes punish and yet when it be do it be with great (@) in buy they make their own prize these snare be strong enough to procure that they never care for return any more to the bosom of the church but that which be worst of all every new prince bestow on they a great largesse and augment their pay at the christian charge they also kill and rob whosoever they please especial the christian throughout the whole country or in march to the war and the christian dare not so much as in a word find themselves aggrieve whereupon there grow in they such a scorn and contempt of the christian name that they remain stranger to it that which I have say of young male child take from out their mother bosom who without perceive it become mahumetan happen in like manner unto they who the pirate by sea or soldier by land make slave present they to the grand signior beside the foresay device the turk further spread abroad their sect with all kind of vantage and furtherance for they abase and bring to extreme misery the christian and moor their subject not permit they to ride nor bear any kind of arm nor to exercise any manner of justice or government they make it lawful to take christian woman that be not marry if the wife of a christian turn Turk and marry herself with a Turk their law permit that the christian husband by turn Turk may take she again they forbid the christian to repair their ruinate church and suffer they in no wise to re-edify they fall down without great bribe and so the christian through poverty let they come to (@) by mean where of the public worship of God fail and in progress of time also the very christian faith and belief in Asia they will not permit the (@) the use of their language but only in sacred administration to the end that together with their language they may also loose and forget their christian fashion and custom the be lord for term of life of infinite village take such young man into their servitude as best please they who in process of time by conversation with their master and the favour they hope after and by the wicked fashion and custom which they learn as also through the sin and vice wherein they be drown do become turk and the greek child after the example of their companion be thus favour and make much of incline in such a sort unto this evil that upon every light occasion they threaten their father and mother to turn turk further it be forbid the mahumetan to make restitution of any place once take with arm and wherein they have build a Moschea to conclude they use all manner of circumstance by mean of which they may amplify or enlarge their dominion and sect of the mahometan of Africa in particular the mahometan impiety have spread itself throughout Africa beyond measure this pestilence enter into Egypt in the year of our lord 637. by the arm of Omar from whence a captain of Odoman first pass into Africa in the year 650. with fower-score thousand fight man who there defeat gregorius but they perpetual cast out of africa the roman with the people of and Leontius the emperor in the year 699. and whole impatronize themselves of Barbary they pierce into Numidia and Libya in the year 710. and overthrow the Azanaghi and the people of Gualata oden and Tombuto the year afterward 973. have pass Gambea they infect the negro and the first that drink of their poison be those of melli. in the year 1067. jaiaia the son of abubequer enter into the low Ethiopia and by little and little subvert those people which confine upon the desert of Libya and Egypt pierce even to Nubia and Guinea the arabian have augment their sect in africa first with force of arm by banish of the natural inhabitant the which they may well do by reason of their infinite multitude and of they that verse of David may well be understand the wicked walk round about according to thy greatness thou have multiply the son of man where they can not come nor give no blow with arm there they have ingraff themselves by preach and traffic the heresy of arrius further their enterprise wherewith the vandal and goth be then inhabiter of Africa be infect to further their designment they bring in the arabic language and letter they found university and study both for riches of revenue and magnificence of building most noble especial in Maroco and Fez. but there be nothing that have greatly further the progression of the mahometan sect than perpetuity of victory and the greatness of conquest first of the Califas in the east and afterward of the Miramolines in Africa in that the great part of man yea and in a manner all except such as have fasten their confidence upon the cross of Christ and settle their hope in eternity follow that which best agree with sense and measure the grace of God by worldly prosperity and yet Christ as justinus the philosopher and glorious martyr testify promise no earthly reward to good work carnal man therefore perceive the empire of the Califas and mahumetan continual to increase in the east and west take into their hand both sea and land for this their felicity in arm continue three hundred year wherein they conquer all that which lie between the river abianus and the atlantike ocean and subdue Spain Sicilia and a part of Italy and France and judge that temporal prosperity and victory be the effect and fruit or at least the argument and sign of the grace and favour of God they easy fall into apostasy whereunto the impiety of arrius and other heretic open the way who for long tract of time estrange themselves more and more from the evangelical truth fall in the end into atheism as we see have fall out in the course of some modern enormity but to return from whence we have digress in progress of time there grow great difference between the mahometan for their sect be no less sottish and foolish then wicked and perfidious the maintainer of it be drive to fetch reason far off for defence of the same but the arabian not content in Africa to have subjugate with arm and with false doctrine to have pester Barbary Numidia Libya and the country of negro they further on the other side assail the low Ethiopia both by sea and land by land enter thereinto in the year 1067. Faiaia the son of abubequer and by mean of certain Alsachi he disperse that pestilence into Nubia and the neighbour province on the other side pass the red sea they first take knowledge of the coast of Ethiopia even to cabo by their continual traffic thither and afterward be encourage by the weakness of the natural inhabitant they erect the kingdom of Magadazo Melinde Mombazza Quiloa mozambique and seize on some port of the island of saint Laurence and gather force by little and little they enlarge their empire within the land and establish therein the kingdom of dangali and adel. so that on the one side they have spread their sect from the red sea to the atlantike ocean and from the Mediterran sea to the river Niger and far and on the other have take into their hand all the eastern coast of africa from suez to cape Guardafu and from this even to that and the adjoin island in which place though the people be not altogether mahumetan yet have the mahometan the weapon and dominion in their hand the which how much it import for the bring in of sect we may easy conceive to conclude they have often assail the Prete janni sometime the turk who have take from he the port of the red sea and otherwhiles the moor under the conduct of the king of adel who have and do molest they great lead into captituitie a great number of abassin where they become for the most part mahumetan of the christian of Africa now that we have declare the misery and darkness of Africa it remain that we set down that little light of true religion which there be the which I can not pass over without exceed glory to the Portugal nation in that they with inestimable charge and infinite travail have first seek to open the way to Ethiopia and to bring the great negus of Abassia call by we Prete janni to the union of the Christian church of Europe perform whatsoever after this for the conversion of the prince of Guinia and meleghette to the faith and yet more happy of the king of congo and the prince of angola and likewise with diverse colony send to the island of the atlantic ocean they have no less advance the honour of their own nation than the propagate of the Christian faith and final pass beyond cabo they have resist the mahometan sect which have now extend itself on the backside of Africa as far as cabo of the christian in Egypt the christian of Egypt be partly stranger partly home-born in the country stranger come thither in regard of traffic which there flourish above measure especial in the city of Alexandria and cairo by reason that this kingdom be most commodious situate between the red and Mediterran sea unite the west part of the world with the east by mean of a infinite traffic and therefore be it as it be a ladder whereby the wealth of India and of the eoan ocean pass into the lesser Asia into Africa and Europe whereupon not only the venetian florentine and ragusian come thither in great number but also the french and English the natural christian of Egypt remain after the spoil and havoc of the barbarian and the cruelty of the saracen mamaluck and turk exceed not the number of fifty thousand person and these dwell disperse here and there but principal in the city of cairo Messia Monfalatto bucco and Elchiasa all place upon the bank of Nilus there be also many in the province of minia in which quarter appear diverse monastery but among the monastery of Egypt those of saint Anthony saint Paul and saint Macarius be the principal the first lie in right over against say it upon a hill where saint Anthony be say to be beat by devil the second be seat not far from this in the midst of a desert the three stand in the wilderness to the west of Bulac this be the monastery which in some history be call Nitria as I think because in that quarter the water of Nilus be thicken by the heat of the sun in low place be convert into salt and Georgia stand upon Nilus six mile from the city of Munsia a rich and magnificent convent so call after the name of saint George there be in the same more than two hundred monk to the notable benefit and ease of pilgrim and stranger who be there courteous lodge but they die all of the plague about some hundred and fifty year sithence the place be abandon now to deliver somewhat concern the estate of these christian they be call by some * * * * or cofti and by other christian from the girdle upward for albeit they be baptize as we be yet do they circumcise themselves like to the jew so as a man may say their christianity come no low than the girdlestead but that which be worse they have for these 1000 year follow the heresy of Eutiches which allow but of one nature in Christ by which heresy they also separate and dismember themselves from the union of the church of Europe the occasion of this separation and (@) be the Ephesine council assemble by dioscorus in defence of Eutiches who be now condemn in the Chalcedon counsel by six hundred and thirty father congregate together by the authority of Leo the first for the cofti fear that to attribute two nature unto Christ may be all one as if they have assign he two hypostasis or person to avoid the heresy of the nestorian they become eutichian they say their divine service in the chaldean tongue oftentimes repeat alleluia they read the gospel first in chaldean and then in arabic when the priest say the young among they lay his hand upon all the people that be present after consecration they give a simple piece of bread to the stander by a ceremony use also in Greece they exercise their function in the church of saint mark amid the ruin of Alexandria and in that of suez upon the red sea they obey the patriarch of Alexandria and affirm themselves to be of the faith of Prete janni in our day two pope
