have attempt to reduce they to the union of the romish church Pius the four and Gregory the thirteen the four in the year 1563. scent two jesuit-priest for this purpose to cairo who stay there almost a year but to no purpose and with great danger of life for one of they be appoint to the fire from which he escape by mean of a merchant who with eight hundred crown pacify the turk and cause the priest sudden to fly away but pope Gregory enter into this enterprise with more hope for Paulo Mariani a famous christian merchant be at the same time in cairo who for his wisdom magnificence knowledge of tongue and long practice in the affair of the world join with wonder eloquence and presence of body be in great esteem and reputation not only among the christian but also with the turk who equal love he for his liberality and honour he for his valour this man have conference with the patriarch of Alexandria about the reconcile of his people to the romish church whereunto the (@) not show himself difficult or hard to be entreat be content to call by his letter into those part two priest of the same order who be then with the maronites in mount Libanus in the mean while the pope who be advertise of all this business take the matter quick in hand write unto the two priest appoint one of they to go direct to cairo and the other to return back to Rome wherefore in the year 1582 in the month of October one of the say priest arrive at cairo be courteous receive by Mariani and afterward conduct to the patriarch who also make show of great joy and consolation one may likewise perceive a reasonable disposition in other who have any authority among the cofti he advertise the pope of all who send a certain other priest with one brief to the patriarch and a other to the jesuit wherein he exhort they to go forward and to bring the union whereof so assure hope be conceive to good effect the patriarch receive the brief with great reverence he kiss it and according to their custom lay it upon his head and afterward demand what it comprehend the which with great feeling and contentment have understand within few day he institute a synod of some bishop and certain other principal person of the nation here the say priest have declare unto they upon how little ground they who at the first receive the faith from saint mark be sequester from the western church by the authority of one heretic take much pain afterward in make they capable of the difference that be between a nature and a or person to their exceed great admiration because they be in a manner destitute of all learning for the patriarch even from his youth have lead his life in the monastery of saint Macarius far not only from the study of learning but also from the conversation of man neither appear there any great knowledge in the bishop they have (@) any book of the ancient father and yet those they have be all dusty and eat with moth that where of they make chief account be a old volume be tear and rend which they call the confession of the father full of diverse dream and fable whereof notwithstanding and of some other arabic book the priest make special good use for the convince of they in their error also have frame a compendium of most necessary doctrine they cause diverse copy of the same to be draw and give they to the learned of the cofti to be consider of who wonder at the strangeness of the thing propound unto they and not know how to answer the argument of the priest demand time to search their own write and to see what opinion their predecessor have hold as concern that point in the mean while they come often to the priest and inquire of they the doctrine and form of speech use in the romish church whereupon they show they how great the same church have ever detest heresy and how severe it have condemn the impiety of Nestorius and contrariwise high esteem the authority of cyrillus alexandrinus and the decree of the first Ephesine council neither because it confess two nature in Christ join in one person without confusion do it therefore infer two or person in that a nature and a person be not the self same thing the which may clear be understand by the deep mystery of the holy trinity wherein we acknowledge one nature and three or person we aver therefore that there be two nature in Christ one divine which he have eternal from his father the other human which he take temporal from the immaculate womb of his mother both of they join in one or person by these and other like demonstration they clear the understand and confirm the mind of the cofti howbeit all this notwithstanding the synod be again assemble wherein be present the patriarch five bishop diverse abbot of monastery and thirty other principal person they plain answer the priest that they have turn over their annal and write and be resolve in no wise to depart from the doctrine and faith of their predecessor this unlooked-for answer though it great trouble and displease the priest yet be they determine still to continue and to proceed further in the enterprise whereupon declare unto they again how far they be by dioscorus mean estrange from the doctrine teach in the Nicen constantinopolitan and first Ephesine counsel ground on the authority of holy scripture and the ancient father and that to disallow of two nature in Christ be no other but to deny that he be neither true god nor man a matter abominable not only to their ear but even to their very understanding they prevail so much as that the matter be yet defer off to a other month be therefore congregate the three time it seem that God himself further this affair more than usual for first with common consent they abrogate the law of circumcision and withal after a disputation of six hour continuance it be decree that as concern the truth of this point the priest be to be believe that there be two nature in Christ and that the cofti though they avoid the name and title of two nature yet deny they not but that Christ be true man and true God only they be wary of the two nature for fear of fall by little and little into two hypostasis thus this business be bring to so good a pass be by the ambition and obstinacy of one man utter cross and hinder this be the vicar or Suffragan to the patriarch who aspire himself to the patriarkship and see that if he follow this union begin with the roman church he can not attain to that dignity but by the pope authority which he altogether misdoubt he first make the decree of two nature to be defer command afterward that none shall subscribe thereunto and final cause the patriarch whole to give over this business and to retire himself into the wilderness whereas he continue for certain month afterward the priest understand where he be write unto he a letter signify therein what a special desire they have to see he and what damage the retire of himself will procure to the silly sheep recommend unto he by God if he ratify not full those thing which be decree upon in the last assembly he courteous answer make show that he will return when he have visit his diocese and in the mean while they shall expect he at cairo but while he think upon return his own death interrupt he the cofti have a law or custom that between the death of one patriarch and the creation of a other there must be in a manner a whole year space for so long it be requisite say they that the church shall bewail the death of her spouse whereupon the priest not to loose so much time determine to go home into Italy to acquaint the pope with the success of all thing and afterward need so require to return the cofti understand thus much write letter to the pope wherein they partly thank he for the care he have of they and partly lament that their reconciliation with the romish church be not full confirm and finish while the priest be about to depart on saint Mathewes day in the morning there come a rout of arm turk to their lodging these lay hand sudden on two priest and another companion of they and on three friar of the order of saint Francis lodge in the same house no man know the reason of this hurly-burly but for as much as can be learn all this grow through the envy of a Frenchman this man aspire to the degree of consul or governor over his nation which Mariani have obtain malicious give the bassa of cairo to understand that Mariani suborn the people against the grand signior and that he have order from the k. of Spain to levy christian man and that to this end he keep in his house certain priest who practise in this behalf with Mariani for the king there be nothing that more prejudice the priest than the Cofties letter which breed a vehement suspicion in the turk that such a union may be conclude with the roman church as may work some extraordinary innovation they be therefore cast into a filthy and stink prison the venetian consul assay first by word of mouth and after by suit and supplication to assuage the fury and anger of the Bassa howbeit he receive such bitter and nip answer that he himself be also afraid but nothing prevail further with the turk than money for it seem that with this only their savage fury be mitigate and their fierceness appease five thousand crown therefore be disburse for the priest liberty wherein the cofti show themselves very friendly the rich of they offer one after another to lend money without any interest for the same but this matter cost Mariani more than ten thousand crown and beside that he be deprive of his degree of consulship the priest be thus free out of prison and observe how thing go return one after another back to Rome a relation touch the state of christian religion in the dominion of Prete janni take out of a oration of Matthew Dresserus professor of the greek and latin tongue and of history in the university of Lipsia who have first make a general exordium to his auditory proceed at length to the peculiar handle of the foresay argument in manner follow say he etc. the space of one hundred year be not as yet full expire since the fame of the ethiopian religion come first unto our ear which because it be in many point agreeable unto christian verity and carry a honest show of piety therewith be to be esteem as a matter most worthy of our knowledge of this therefore so far forth as the short time of a oration will permit I purpose to entreat to the end it may appear both where and what manner of christian church that of Ethiopia be and what be the first beginning thereof this ethiopian not unfit call * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * as the church in all the hither part of Europe have be call the western and that of Greece and Asia the (@) church the southern church be situate in Africa far south namely under the torrid zone between the tropic of cancer and the equinoctial some part thereof also stretch beyond the equinoctial towards the tropic of Capricorn two summer they have every year yea in a manner one continual summer so that at the very same time in some field they sow and in other they reap somewhere also they have every month ripe some kind of earthly fruit or other especial pulse the people be skorch with the heat of the sun and they be black and go naked save only that some cover their privity with cloth of cotton or of silk the country be very great and contain well nigh twenty kingdom * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * whantsoever Dresserus think yet diverse other author of good note do hold the dominion of Prete janni to be nothing so large so that it be almost as large as Europe or as all Christendom in these part at the beginning indeed it have not above two kingdom but in process of time it be mighty enlarge by the conquest of country adjacent for it be environ on all side by unbelieve gentile and (@) who be most deadly enemy to the christian religion with who the emperor of Ethiopia be at continual war endeavour by all possible mean to reclaim they from their heathenish idolatry to the faith of jesus Christ it be report that certain border * * * * * * * these moor be call moor bear such implacable hatred against these christian that none of they may (@) before he bring testimony that he have slay twelve of (@) the (@) of Ethiopia be not call as some imagine (@) or priest but precious John for in the ethiopian tongue he be term Belul gian and in the chaldean Encoe gian both which addition signify precious or high so that in a manner he come near unto the title of our prince who be call etc. to signify that they be exalt and advance above other people and this be a common name to all the Christian king of Ethiopia as Pharaoh be to the egyptian king and Augustus to the roman emperor neither be this precious John a priest by profession but a civil magistrate nor be he arm so much with religion and law as with military force howbeit he call himself the pillar of faith because he be the maintainer of the christian faith not only enjoin his own subject to the observation thereof but what in he lie enforce his enemy also to embrace it in time past Ethiopia be govern by queen only whereupon we read in the history of the old testament that the queen of the south come to king Solomon from Saba to hear his admirable wisdom about the year of the world 2954. the name of this queen as the ethiopian report be Maqueda who from the head-city of Ethiopia call Saba which like a isle be environ on all side by the river Nilus travel by Egypt and the red sea to jerusalem and she bring unto Solomon a hundred and twenty talent of gold which amount to 720000. golden ducat of Hungary that be seven ton of gold and 20000 hungarian ducat beside this mighty sum of gold with other thing of great value she present unto Solomon who likewise requite she with most princely gift she contend with he also in propound of sage question and obscure riddle among other matter as it be report by cedrenus she bring before he certain damosel and young man in maid attire ask the king how he can discern one sex from another he answer that he will find they out by the wash of their face and forthwith he command all their face to be wash and they which wash themselves strong be find to be male but the residue by their tender wash bewray themselves to be damosel the ethiopian king suppose that they be descend from the lineage of David and from the family of Solomon and therefore they use to term themselves the son of David and of Solomon and of the holy patriarch also as be spring from their progeny for queen Maqueda say they have a son by Solomon who they name Meilech but afterward he be call David this Meilech as they report be grow to twenty year of age be send back by his mother unto his father and instructor Solomon that he may learn of he wisdom and understanding which so soon as the say Meilech or David have attain by the permission of Solomon take with he many priest and noble out of all the twelve tribe he return to his kingdom of Ethiopia and take upon he the government thereof as likewise he carry home with he the law of God and the rite of circumcision these be the beginning of the jewish religion in Ethiopia and it be report that even till this present none be admit into any ministry or canonship in the court but such as be descend of their race that come first out of iury. by these therefore the doctrine of God in Ethiopia be first plant which afterward take such deep root as it have since remain to all succeed age for the ethiopian do both retain the book of the prophet and travail also to jerusalem that they may there worship the true God reveal in the kingdom of Israel which manifest appear act of the apost cap. 8. verse 26. out of the history of the ethiopian eunuch who name be Indich which be a principal governor under queen Candaces proper call judith for he about the ten year after the death and resurrection of our bless saviour travail for the space of two hundred and forty mile to jerusalem where have perform due worship unto God return homeward as he sit in his chariot he read the prophet esaias and by the commandment of the holy spirit philip one of Christ his disciple be send unto he and when they be both come to the city Bethzur three mile distant from jerusalem the eunuch at the foot of a mountain espy a certain water wherein he be baptize by philip. and be return into Ethiopia this eunuch baptize the queen and a great part of her family and people from which time the ethiopian begin to be christian who since that have continual profess the christian faith they believe also that Philip send into Ethiopia a disciple of his call lycanon who as they suppose ordain the very form of religion which they now hold now these beginning aswell of the jewish as the Christian religion among the ethiopian be thus declare we be next to entreat of the doctrine and religion itself together with the rite and ceremony use at this present in the ethiopicke church so far forth as we can gather out of the ambassage which have be perform from these part thither and back again beside which there be no history nor discourse of any worth to be find which entreat of the religion manner and custom of the ethiopian so as it be a matter very strange that for so many hundred year together Ethiopia be so bar from our knowledge that we have not so much as any report thereof until about the year of our lord 1440. certain ambassador send from thence to pope Eugenius return back with his letter and papal benediction to their king which letter be most chary keep among the record of this ethiopian king and be preserve for perpetual monument from which time also as though Ethiopia have be again choir debar from the knowledge and conversation of our man there be not any european that go into Ethiopia nor any ethiopian that come into Europe till the year of our lord 1486. what time John the second king of Portugal send Pedro de Covilham and alonco de to search out Ethiopia this Pedro be a man very learned eloquent skilful in sundry language painful in his endeavour fortunate in his attempt and most desirous to find out new country and people both by sea and land he therefore in the year above mention together with his companion alonco de (@) who die in the voyage travail first to Alexandria and cairo in Egypt from whence in the company of certain moor of Fez and tremizen he proceed on to el Tor a haven town upon the arabian shore of the red sea and thence to aden situate without the entrance of the arabian gulf where have embark himself in a ship of moor he travail to Calicut goa and other place of the east indies and be full inform of the state of the spicery he cross over the main ocean to cofala sail thence to Ormuz and then return back to cairo from whence have dispatch letter unto his king in the company of rabbi joseph a jew he make a second voyage to Ormuz and in his return he take his journey towards Ethiopia the emperor whereof at that time be call Alexander unto who when he have deliver a letter and a map of the world send from king John he be most kind entertain and reward with many rich gift and albeit he most earnest desire to return into his own country yet can he never obtain leave but have wealth honour and a wife of a noble family bestow upon he to assuage his desire of return home wherefore in the year 1526. which be forty year after his departure out of Portugal he be leave by rodrigo de lima the Portugal ambassador still remain in the court of Prete janni in all this mean while sundry portugal come out of India to the court of the Prete not so much to visit and salute he as to declare the good will and kind affection of their king towards he whereupon queen Helena which be then protectress of the ethiopian or Abassin empire to requite the king of Portugal with like friendship send unto he in the company of the foresay portugal a ambassador or messenger of she call Matthew who be a merchant bear in Armenia be a man skilful in matthew the first ambassador send from Aethiopia to Portugal sundry language and in many other matter this Matthew she not only furnish with letter requisite for such a ambassage but enjoin he also to declare by word of mouth unto the king of Portugal the principal head of their doctrine or belief together with their rite and custom and the present state of the whole church of Ethiopia moreover she present he with a little cross make as they suppose of a piece of that very cross whereon our saviour Christ be crucify with many other token and pledge of mutual Christian amity thus Matthew be dismiss take his journey to the east indies from whence he be conduct by sea into Portugal where arrive in the year 1513 he do his message according to queen helenas direction unto the king don Emanuel the king take wonderful delight at this message and at these gift which be send he from a christian prince so far remote not long after prepare a new * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * this ambassage be at the first undertake by odoardo Galuano who die at the isle of (@) in the red sea it be perform by rodrigo de Lima. ambassage with letter and present of exceed value in which ambassage the piety and virtue of Francis Aluarez a Portugal priest extraordinary appear for he remain six whole year in the court and country of Ethiopia take there most diligent notice of all matter worthy the observation and he have often and familiar conference not only with the emperor himself but also with the patriarch concern the whole state of their religion and of matter ecclesiastical as also he be a most curious observer of all their rite and ceremony who in the year of Christ 1526. being dismiss by Prete janni be accompany into Zagazabo the second ambassador send from AEthiopia to Portugal Portugal by another ethiopian or Abassin ambassador call Zagazabo and bring letter also to pope Clement the seven with a golden cross of a pound weight it seem likewise that the say ambassador of Prete janni be a very honest upright and godly man who by reason of their continual war be detain in Portugal till the year of our lord 1539. the letter of Prete janni to the pope be by Francis Aluarez deliver at Bononia in the year of Christ 1533. where in the presence of Charles the emperor and before a mighty assembly of people they be read and approve with great joy and acclamation both which letter as well to the pope as to the king don Emanuel be full of christian piety and love wherein first that mighty emperor though therein he be deceive with singular reverence and duty submit himself unto the pope of Rome as to the head of all the church offer by the say Francis most humble obedience after the manner of other christian prince as likewise he proffer unto they both the office of benevolence charity and true friendship intend to join a firm league of amity with they and signify that his dominion be free and open to all christian that will by sea or land frequent the same also he plain seem to detest the mutual discord of christian exhort they to bandy their force against the mahometan and promise his royal assistance and most earnest endeavour for the vanquish of Christ enemy and their conversion to the truth last he require that man of learning and of skill in the holy scripture as likewise diligent printer and all sort of artificer may be send he to be employ in the service of his church and common wealth signify that he will not violent detain any man in his dominion but will dismiss he into his own country with honour and liberal reward and that he may testify his love and kind affection to the king of Portugal by a most worthy monument he send he the crown off his own head as the present of (@) dutiful son to his most dear father wherefore by this most admirable diligence and industry of the portugal Ethiopia in these last time have be discover and make know unto we neither be there any thing in the ethiopian religion so hide and unrevealed which have not either be find out by Francis Aluarez or most large declare by Zagazabo the ethiopian ambassador out of the relation therefore of these two worthy author as out of a fountain we will derive the whole substance of our speech the ground of the ethiopicke religion be the profession of one true God and of his son jesus Christ which of all christian be the peculiar and proper mark whereby only they be to be name christian concern this main point the ethiopian faith stand most firm and entire for they together with we do confess and adore one God and three person of the deity God the father God the son beget of his father from everlasting who for we man be incarnate die and rise again and God the holy ghost proceed from the father and the son in this article they follow the holy creed of the apostle and the nicene creed save that they hold that Christ descend into hell for his own soul and for the soul of Adam which he receive of the virgin Marie for this opinion they do most steadfast embrace say that it come by most ancient tradition from Christ himself to his apostle the old testament they so conjoin with the new as they allow and receive both jewish and christian ceremony upon the eight day after their birth * * * * * * * * * whereas the jew circumcise the male (@) they circumcise all child both male and female and unless sickness urge they to make the more haste they defer the baptism of their male child till they be forty and of their female till they be eighty day old circumcision they say they receive from queen Maqueda which go to hear the wisdom of Solomon and baptism from saint Philip and from the eunuch which Philip baptize yet do they steadfast hold that not by circumcision but by faith in jesus Christ they attain unto true felicity their baptism they (@) every year for upon the day of the three sage otherwise call Epiphanie whereon Christ be baptize in jordan they meet in great assembly and enter naked into the water where the priest lay his hand upon they dip they thrice and pronounce the word of baptism say I baptize thou in the name of the father the son and the holy ghost add thereto the sign of the cross this custom receive from their predecessor they do most careful observe not thereby to abase or extenuate their first baptism but that every year they may receive a new absolution from their sin also unto their infant upon the very day of their baptism they give the body of our lord under a small morsel of bread but such as be grow to year of discretion before they come unto the lord holy supper do make confession and receive absolution of all their sin from the priest then do they all betimes in the morning both clergy and laiety receive the whole sacrament of the body and true blood of jesus Christ in their church which be receive they may not under pain of grievous punishment so much as once spit till the go down of the sun popish confirmation and unction they neither esteem for sacrament nor use they the pope of Rome either in regard of error and ignorance or to win his favour they acknowledge to be head of the church and do pretend a kind of obedience to the sea of Rome albeit that the pope before the portugal discovery of the east indies can never communicate any assistance unto they * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * yet in the time of pope Paul the 4. be send certain priest with a new create patriarch and two (@) who notwithstanding when they go (@) about to bring in the (@) religion and the supremacy of the pope be cross by the emperor in all their proceed nor yet since that time by reason of the huge distance almost of fifteen thousand mile for so many mile the ambassador which be send out of Portugal to Ethiopia say that he have travail it be nothing so long a journey through Egypt and Barnagasso but that the way through those country be stop by the (@) of the turk howbeit queen Helena and after her king David seem only to have seek and desire some conjunction with the roman church and the christian of Europe to the end that with their power and force unite they may assail and vanquish the mahometan be most deadly enemy to the christian name moreover these ethiopic christian do use to fast upon certain day of the week till sun set as namely upon wednesday to renew the sad memory of the jew council wherein they decree to crucify our redeemer and upon friday that they may with thankful mind acknowledge his most bitter passion and death likewise the day of good friday whereon our bless saviour be nail to the cross they celebrate with great devotion especial towards the evening unto these they add a lent of forty day wherein they live only by bread and water the feast both of Christ of the virgin Marie and of certain saint they keep holy upon which day meet in their church three hour after sunrising they read the book of the prophet and employ themselves in holy exercise they sanctify the Sabaoth in (@) of the jew and keep holy the lord day according to the apostle institution on both these day they worship God by perform thing holy and eschue matter profane into their church they may not come but barefoot only neither be it there lawful for any man to walk up and down nor to talk of worldly affair nor to spit nor cough the chief use of the law they say be to show we our sin neither do they think any man live able to perform the same but only jesus Christ who fulfil it on our behalf the saint they love indeed and reverence but do not pray unto they unto the bless virgin Marie the mother of Christ they ascribe great honour but neither do they adore she nor crave assistance at her hand they have every day one mass only and that a short one in stead of a sacrifice but gain thereby they make none at all neither do they elevate or hold up the sacrament of the supper as the masspriest do nor apply the same to redeem dead man soul from the pain of purgatory howbeit that there be a place of purgatory they do not deny wherefore their dead be bury with cross and supplication and especial with the rehearsal of the begin of saint john gospel then the day follow they offer alm for they and upon certain day after they add funerall-banquet suppose that upon sabbath and the lord day they which die godly be free from all torment in purgatory and at length have receive the full measure of chastisement for their sin that then they go into eternal rest for the effect whereof they do not think any indulgence of their (@) but only the mere mercy and grace of God to be available marriage be no less permit to their clergy and priest then to their laie-people yet so that his first wife be dead a priest can marry another without the patriarch dispensation whosoever keep a concubine be debar from all sacred administration and whatsoever bishop or clergyman be find to have a bastard he be utter deprive of holy order and of all his benefice and spiritual dignity marriage be often solemnize without the church a bed be place before the house of the bride and the bridegroom then come three priest who go thrice about the bridegroom bed sing with a loud voice Halleluiah and other thing this do they cut one lock of hair from the bridegroom head and another from the head of the bride which they wash in wine make of honey and then put upon either of their head the other lock they sprinkle they with a kind of holy-water and so depart which be perform the mariage-feast begin and hold on till the night be far spend at length the bride and bridegroom be bring unto their own house out of which neither of they may go forth for the space of a whole month after in some place they be marry in the church by the patriarch himself where the marriage-bed stand in manner aforesaid the patriarch with sweet incense and cross walk thrice about it and then turn himself towards they he lay his hand upon the bridegroom head say do that which god have command in his gospel and think now that you be not two but one flesh have speak these word he administer the communion unto they and bless they polygamy or many wife at once be permit by the emperor and civil magistrate unto the ethiopian but in their church there be no place at all for such as have more wife than one neither may any such person presume to enter into their church but be hold as excommunicate and be not receive into the congregation before have put away all the residue of their wife they betake themselves to one only divorcement they use very common and often upon light occasion except only the priest who may by no mean depart from their wife whereby it appear that their priest approve not that inconstancy in a matter of so great moment the best remedy which they have to prevent this mischief be at the day of marriage to alotte some great penalty upon that person which shall first forsake the other among they likewise according to the law of Moses brother use to marry their brother wife to raise up seed unto they howbeit this abuse of marriage be not practise by all but only by the mighty sort for the countrypeople and those of poor condition be every one content with his own wife do so painful employ themselves about their labour and the get of their (@) that they be free from those violent passion of lust infant that die before baptism they name half christian because be sanctify only by the faith of (@) parent they be not as yet by baptism thorough engraft into the church from meat which the law of Moses account unclean they also do abstain the heresy of arrius macedonius and Nestorius they reject and condemn the whole church of Ethiopia be govern by a patriarch call in the ethiopic language Abuna which signify a father this patriarch of they be first solemn create at jerurasem by the voice of those monk which keep the sepulchre of our Lord afterwards he be confirm and send into Ethiopia by the patriarch of Alexandria the emperor Prete janni so often as there be need of a new patriarch send a ambassage with many gift to jerusalem and require a patriarch from thence which patriarch together with a monk of the order of saint Antony the hermit be come into Ethiopia be according to a ancient custom receive with the general consent congratulation applause and rejoice of all degree and estate of people to this high function be single out some one man of singular piety gravity (@) and of more ancient year than the rest his special duty be to give holy order to administer church-discipline and to excommunicate contumace or obstinate offender which be for their stubbornness famish to death but the authority of give bishopric and spiritual benefice the emperor reserve to himself in Ethiopia there be infinite number of priest and of monk Francis Aluarez see at one time ordain by the patriarch two thousand three hundred fifty six priest and the like manner of ordain or instalment they have every year twice it seem that those which be choose into that order be man destitute of learning and liberal art unto their priesthood none be admit before he be full thirty year of age it fall out likewise that during the vacation of the patriarkship the church have great want of priest which vacation be often time prolong by reason of the continual war between the christian and the border mahumetan and gentile whereby all passage from Ethiopia to the monk of jerusalem be quite cut off hence proceed great desolation in that church but with monk all place in this Abassin empire do mighty swarm these do not only confine themselves in monastery whereof here be great number but also take upon they office in the court and entangle themselves in military affair and in buy and sell of merchandise neither be there any kind of people in those eastern part more conversant in trade of merchandise than priest (@) monk so that the old say saw be most true verify what ere the world do put in ure the monk will intermeddle sure it be (@) to be note that the priest monk and other minister of (@) ethiopian church be not maintain by tithe and alm as they be in Europe they have only certain field and garden which must be manure by the monk and clergy themselves to beg aught of the common people they be in no wise permit unless perhaps some man will of his own accord bestow somewhat in their church for the exequy of the dead or for some other sacred use these ethiopian have a certain book which they suppose to have be write by all the apostle when they be assemble at jerusalem this book in their language they call Manda and Abetilis and do believe that all thing therein contain be to be hold for gospel in it among other matter be contain certain penal statute as for example if a priest be convict of adultery manslaughter robbery or perjury he be to receive like punishment with other malefactor likewise that aswell ecclesiastical as secular person be to abstain from come to church for the space of four and twenty hour after carnal copulation some law also there be concern the purification of woman after their month and their childbirth which because we can make but little use of they I do here pass over in silence one thing there be in this book very well provide namely that twice every year there be a synod assemble in the church of Christ for the handle and discuss of all matter ecclesiastical these be the principal point of the religion faith and ceremony of the ethiopicke church under Prete janni which hitherto have come to our knowledge a good part whereofis agreeable unto the scripture of the old and new testament and such in very deed they be as represent unto we the acknowledgement of one true God and the faith and worship of our only lord and saviour jesus Christ but as never any church upon earth be quite void of blemish so neither be this of Ethiopia free from all stain of error which notwithstanding may seem the less strange because in Ethiopia there be no school nor seminary of liberal art save only that the priest themselves according to their simple skill train up their son unto such learning as may in time make they capable of priesthood neither be there ever any man yet that reform their error Francis Aluarez report that the patriarch of this ethiopic church in a certain private conference do grievous complain of all such error as be there maintain and be most earnest desirous of a reformation which desire of he as it be most holy and commendable so be it by all christian to be approve god almighty grant that the ethiopian may one day attain to the accomplishment of this his compassionate well-wishing and may have a happy reformation of their church for this to desire and pray for be far more convenient and christian-like then to disgrace they with reproachful word and to bereave they of the name of christian which hard and unchristian measure Zagazabo the ethiopian ambassador report with grief that he find among the popish priest of Portugal by who he be quite restrain from the use and communion of the (@) supper as ifhe have be a mere Gentile or anathema it be indeed a error or rather a great infirmity that they do as yet retain and use some of the jewish ceremony but we be (@) to impute it to their ignorance of christian liberty and whereas they permit marriage to their priest it be neither repugnant to the sacred word of God nor to the institution of the apostle wherefore it ought not to be disallow of any christian unless they will prefer the decree of the pope before the commandment of God establish by Christ and his apostle whereby it may plain appear how impious and savage the priest of Portugal deal in that especial for this cause they so sharp inney against the ethiopic ambassador and so uncivil entreat he their yearly renew ofbaptisme be at the first bring in by error and since by ancient use and tradition have grow authentical for in very deed so great be the force of antiquity and custom that where they once take root they can hardly be remove and it be a wonder that the ethiopian do so often repeat baptism when as they can be circumcise any more than once but in regard of all these defect what can we better devise to do then in our daily prayer to wish they mind better inform and the purity and integrity of faith which be agreeable unto god word the ethiopian conceive exceed joy at the first arrival of the portugal in their country hope that their mutual acquaintance and familiarity will breed a similitude and conjunction as well of their religion as of their affection and mind but I be very afraid lest the reproachful and stern carriage of the popish priest and monk towards the ethiopic ambassador before mention have more than ever in time past estrange the mind of that nation from the christian of Europe howbeit the singular care and industry of those two renown prince John the second and Emanuel king of Portugal be most high to be extol and celebrate who by infinite charge employ upon their navigation to the east indies and to these part have open a way for the european christian to the southern church of Ethiopia and for the ethiopian to this western church of Europe which have not these two worthy prince bring to effect we shall not so much as have know the name of a christian church in Ethiopia for thither by the way of Arabia and Egypt in regard of the arabian and mahometan most deadly enmity to the christian faith it be so dangerous and difficult to travel as it seem to be quite bar and shut up unless therefore over the atlantike Ethiopick and indian sea the portugal have thither find a passage by navigation it have almost be impossible for any ambassador or other person to have come out of Ethiopia into these western part thus (@) Matthew Dresserus a ambassage send from pope Paul the four to Claudius the emperor of Abassia or the high Ethiopia for plant of the religion and ceremony of the church of Rome in his dominion which ambassage take none effect at all in the year 1555 John the three king of Portugal determine to leave no mean unattempted for the absolute reconciliation of Prete janni unto the church of Rome for though David ambassador have perform obedience to pope Clement the seven on his emperor behalf yet doubt the king of Portugal as true it be that for want of speedy prosecution those forward beginning will prove but altogether fruitless in that for all this they still embrace the heresy of dioscorus and Eutiches and depend on the authority of the patriarch of Alexandria receive their Abuna from he who be the sole arbitrator of all their matter ecclesiastical the of their sacrament the giver of order over all Ethiopia master of their ceremony and instructor of their faith whereupon he suppose that he can not do any thing more profitable or necessary then to send thither a patriarch appoint at Rome who may exercise spiritual authority over they as also with he some priest of singular integrity and learning who with their sermon disputation and discourse both public and private may reduce those people from their error and heresy to the truth and may confirm and strengthen they in the same and unto this it seem a wide gate be already open because not many year before Claudius the emperor of Ethiopia receive great succour from the portugal against Graadamet king of Zeila who have bring he to a hard point and in a letter write from he to Stephen gama he call Christopher gama his brother who die in this war by the reverend name of a martyr the king of Portugal therefore have impart this his resolution first with pope julius the three and then with Paul the four it be by they conclude to send into Ethiopia thirteen priest man of principal estimation and account above other of their quality John nun Barretto be make patriarch and there be join unto he two assist bishop Melchior Carnero and Andrea under title of the bishop of Nicaea and hierapolis king John set forth this ambassage not only with whatsoever the voyage itself necessary require but further with all royal preparation and rich present for Prete janni nevertheless the better to lay open a entrance for the patriarch there be by the king appointment send before from the city of goa jago Dias and with he gonsaluo rodrigo into Ethiopia to discover the mind of the neguz and the disposition of his people these two be admit to the presence of that prince show he the letter of king John wherein he congratulate with he on the behalf of all christian for that follow the example of his grandfather and father he have embrace the christian faith and union whereat Claudius be amaze ' as at a thing never before think of and the emperor of Ethiopia will by no mean admit the supremacy and religion of the romish church it be demand why he have write to the king of Portugal to that effect he excuse himself by the writer and interpreter of his letter add thereunto that though he esteem that king as his very good brother yet be he never mind to swerve one jot from the faith of his predecessor Roderigo for all this be no whit daunt but wrought all mean to bring Claudius to his opinion but the great difficulty against this his busy enterprise be the ignorance of the emperor and the prince of Ethiopia in all the general counsel and ancient history afterward perceive that the neguz do not willing admit he to audience he write and divulge a book in the chaldean tongue wherein confute the opinion of the the abassin he labour mighty to advance the authority of the roman church which book raise so great a tumult that the emperor to avoid worse inconvenience which be likely to ensue be fain quick to suppress it jago Dias perceive that he do but loose time and the term of his return approach take his leave of the neguz and have make know in goa how matter stand it be not think requisite that the patriarch shall expose his own person together with the reputation of the roman church unto so great hazard but rather not whole to abandon the enterprise they determine to send thither Andrew Ouiedo new elect bishop of hierapolis with two or three assistant who with great authority may debate of that which Roderigo already have so unfruitful treat of Ouiedo most willing undertake this attempt put himself on the voyage with father Emanuel fernandez and some few other when he be come into Abassia he stand in more need of patience than disputation for king Claudius within a few month after be vanquish and Adamas a new emperor of Ethiopia slay Adamas his brother succeed who be a great enemy to the sea of Rome this man draw (@) and his assistant to the war with he and entreat they most barbarous as also those abassin who they have convert he likewise be afterward overthrow in battle by the turk who strip Ouiedo and his companion of all thing that they have whereupon they grow into such poverty and misery as all help fail they they be enforce to get their live with the plough and spade till they all die one after another this ethiopian christianity be bring at this day to a hard point by the invasion of the turk and moor as be before declare notwithstanding their religious man affirm that they have prophecy of the come of a christian nation to their port from far country with who they shall go to the destruction of the moor and these they hold to be Portugal they have far certain presagement of saint Sinoda who be a egyptain hermite of the ruin of Mecca the recovery of the holy sepulchre and the take of Egypt and cairo by the abassin unite with the latin of the christian of the isle of Socotera vicinity of place and conformity of custom invite i to cross the sea and to visit the christian of Socotera this island be sixty mile long and five and twenty in breadth it be situate over against the red sea the people thereof receive the faith from saint Thomas the apostle for they affirm that here he suffer shipwreck and that of the break and batter ship he build a church which be as yet extant they imitate for the most part the rite custom and fashion of the abassin but with great ignorance and error for be separate from all commerce with the christian of these part they remain deprive of that spiritual help which the western church by communication may impart unto they they retain circumcision and some other moisaicall ceremony also they pray for the dead and observe ordinary fast have prefix hour for prayer and bear great reverence to their religion in honour whereof they build chapel wherein assemble together with a high and loud voice they make supplication and prayer in the Hebrew tongue but their far distance as I say from these part of Christendom the sterility of the island and the poverty of the people be occasion that the little light of truth which they have be in a manner quite eclipse by multitude of error unto other thing may be add the tyranny of the king of Fartac a mahometan who subdue Fartac a country of Arabia Felix the king whereof subdue the isle of Zocotera 1482. they about the year of our lord 1482. and partly by dominion partly by affinity and kindred and partly also by conversation bring in among they the deadly poison of Mahumet from this servitude they be but because the charge far surmount any benefit that come of the island not long after the say fortress be ruinate and the island abandon by the portugal John the three king of Portugal have a great Prete janni there arrive certain ambassador from Nubia to make (@) unto that prince for some priest and minister of the gospel and sacrament by who they may be instruct in the christian faith but Prete janni answer they that he have not enough for his own country whereupon they return home very discontent so that have no help from the christian and on the otherside be daily solicit by the mahometan upon who they border on many side it be think that at this present they remain in a manner without any religion at all notwithstanding at this day there be more than a hundred and fifty church stand with diverse other note and sign of Christianity their language partake much with the egyptain and no less with the chaldean and arabic of the christian in the king doom of congo hitherto we have describe that little which remain of the ancient christianity of africa it now rest that we give some notice of that which have be bring in of late congo be a kingdom about the bigness of France situate as be before say beyond the equinoctial between cabo da Catherina and bahia it be convert to christian religion by the mean of don John the second king of Portugal in manner follow don Diego canon a captain of that king by his commission coast along Africa after a great navigation arrive at length in the great river of Zaire and (@) to sail up into it he discover along the bank thereof many town where he find much more affability in the inhabitant then in those of other country which before he have discover and that he may be able to give the more faithful advertisement thereof to his king his hart move he to go to the court of that kingdom whither beinng come and courteous bring to the king presence he show they the vanity of their idolatry and the high reverence of Christian faith and he find in that prince so good a disposition as return into Portugal beside a ambassador he be permit to carry with he certain youth of noble parentage to the end they may learn the christian doctrine and be well instruct therein and be baptize also may afterward be send back with Portugal priest to preach the gospel and to plant the christian faith in that kingdom these youth remain in Portugal two year and be there liberal entertain and with all diligence instruct in matter of religion and be at length with great solemnity baptize when they come to ripe year king John send they back again into their own country with a honourable ambassage in who company go for teacher and instructer of that nation three dominick-fryer repute for man of exquisite learning and holy life be arrive in congo they first convert mani-sogno the king uncle with one of his son after that ensue the baptism of the king and queen for which cause in short time there be a goodly church erect under the name and title of Santa Cruz. and in the mean while there be infinite idol burn the king be call John the queen Leonora and his elder son Alonso this Alonso be a singular good man who not be satisfy in his own conversion labour also with a kind of apostolical zeal for the conversion of his subject but let no man think that the plant of religion can ever pass without some labour and trouble these dominick-fryer beside the intemperature of the air and unusual heat which consume they be also evil entreat by the * * * * * * * * * so be the inhabitant of congo call moci-congi for although they show themselves docible and tractable enough while they be instruct only about ceremony and divine mystery because they think that the high those matter be above human capacity the more they sort and be agreeable to the majesty of God nevertheless when they begin to entreat serious of temperance continence restitution of other man good forgive of injury and other head of christian piety they find not only great hindrance and difficulty but even plain resistance and opposition the king himself who have from the beginning show notable zeal be now somewhat cool who because he be loath to abandon his soothsaier and fortune teller but above all the multitude of his concubine this be a general difficulty among the barbarian will by no mean give ear unto the preacher also the woman who be now reject one after another not endure so sudden to be banish from their husband bring the court and royal city of saint Saluador into a great uproar * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
