God favour Alonso in this war with manifest miracle for first they affirm that be ready to enter into battle he see a light so clear and resplendent that he and his company which behold it remain for a good while with their eye decline and their mind so full and replenish with joy and a kind of tender affection that can easy be express and then lift up their eye unto heaven they see five shine sword which the king take afterward for his arm and his successor use the same at this day have obtain this victory he assemble all his noble and straight enjoin they to bring all the idol of his country to a appoint place and so upon a high hill he cause they all to be burn this Alonso reign prosperous for fifty year together in which space he exceed further by authority and example as also by preach and doctrine the new-planted christianity neither do don Emanuel the king of Portugal give over this enterprise for he send from thence to congo twelve of those friar which the portugal call Azzurri of who friar John Mariano be head with architect and smith for the building and service of church and with rich furniture for the same after king Alonso succeed don Pedro his son in who time there be a bishop appoint over the isle of saint Thomas who have also commit unto he the administration of congo where at the city of saint Saluador be institute a college of eight and twenty canon in the church of Santa Cruz. the second bishop be of the blood royal of congo who travail to Rome and die in his return homeward don Francisco succeed don Pedro who continue but a small space and don Diego his near kinsman be after his decease advance to the crown in who time John the three king of Portugal understand that neither the king himself care great for religion and that the merchant and priest of Europe further not but rather with their bad life scandalize the people new convert he send thither four jesuit to renew and reestablish matter of religion these man arrive first at the isle of saint Thomas and then at congo be courteous receive by the king and present go about the business they come for one of they take upon he to teach six hundred young child the principle of Christian religion and the other disperse themselves over the whole country to preach but all of they one after another fall into tedious and long disease they be enforce to return into Europe at this time there be appoint over congo a three bishop of the Portugal nation who through the contumacy of the canon and clergy find trouble enough in the mean while don Diego die there arise great tumult touch the succession by mean whereof all the portugal in a manner that be in saint Saluador except priest be slay in the end Henry brother to don Diego obtain the crown and after he for he quick die in the war of the Anzichi don Alvaro his son in law this man reconcile unto himself the Portugal nation cause all the religious and lay sort disperse here and there throughout the kingdom to be gather together and write for his discharge to the king and to the bishop of saint Thomas the bishop have peruse the letter pass himself into congo and give some order for the discipline of the clergy he return to saint Thomas where he end his day it so fall out that what for the absence and what for the want of bishop the progression of religion be much hinder for one don Francisco a man for * call by Philippo Pigafetto (@) blood and wealth of no small authority begin free to say that it be a vain thing to cleave to one wife only and afterwards in the end he fall altogether from the faith and be a occasion that the king grow wonderful cold they affirm that this Francisco die and be bury in the church of Santa cruz the devil uncover a part of that church roof and with terrible noise draw his dead carcase out of the tomb and carry it quite away a matter that make the king exceed amaze but yet another accident that ensue withal strike he near to the hart for the Giacchi leave their own habitation enter like locust into the kingdom concern these Giacchi otherwise call agag read the discourse of Mohenemugi before the begin of John leo. of congo and come to battle against don Alvaro the king put he to flight who not be secure in the head city abandon his kingdom and together with the Portugal priest and his own prince retire himself unto a island of the river Zaire call the isle of horse thus see himself bring to such extremity for beside the loss of his kingdom his people die of famine and misery and for maintenance of life sell themselves one to another and to the portugal also at a base price for reparation of his state and religion he have recourse to don Sebastian king of Portugal and obtain of he six hundred soldier by who valour he drive his enemy out of the kingdom and within a year and a half reestablish himself in his throne in his time Antonio di glioun Spaniard be make bishop of saint Thomas who after much molestation procure he by the captain of that island go at length into congo with two friar and four priest and order matter reasonable well in the mean while don Alvaro die and his son of the same name succeed he who fail not to solicit both don Sebastian and don Henry king of Portugal and the king of Spain also that they will send he some competent number of preacher and ecclesiastical person for the augmentation of the christian faith in his kingdom and amid these determination he die and a son of his call also don Alvaro succeed he during these tumult certain other Portugal priest go into congo labour to prune that vine which have be long time give over and forsake these man have build they a house in the island of Loanda where do remain six or seven of their company that be ready to go sometime hither and sometime thither as need require in the year of our lord 1587. king Alvaro who because he be not bear of lawful matrimony be but little esteem by his people will needs have one of these priest about he by who mean and authority he come to reputation and credit and God himself favour his proceed for meet a sister of he by the father side and one of her brother with a great army in the field he give he battle and bear himself therein with such valour as he do not only overthrow the force of his enime but further slay the ringleader and general thereof and in the place where he be slay he will needs build a church to the honour of Christianity and the more by his own example to move other himself be the very first man that put hand to this work and likewise with edict and favourable proclamation he further and do still advance the preach of the gospel and the propagation of religion who so be desirous to be more full instruct concern the christianity of this kingdom let he read the three and eight book of Osorius reb. gest Eman. and the second book of Philippo Pigafetta his story of congo most proper and decent translate by the judicious master Abraham Hartwell of the christian religion in the kingdom of angola those Portugal priest that remain in the island Loanda as above we declare bend themselves more to the conversion of angola then of congo the reason be as I suppose because the enterprise be new and more near concern the portugal who there make war under the conduct of Paulo diaz to get possession of the mountain of cabambe which abound with rich mine of very fine silver it seem that god have favour the amplification of his holy name in those part with some miraculous victory for first in the year 1582 a few portugal in a excursion that they make put to flight a innumerable company of the Angolans and by this victory they bring in a manner the half of that kingdom into their hand and many prince and noble of the land upon this be move to request and make suit to be baptize among who be Songa prince of Banza the king father in law who brother and child be baptize already Tondella also the second person of angola be convert many idol be throw to the ground and instead thereof they erect cross and build some church and within this little while all the province of Corimba be in a manner convert also in the year 1584. a hundred and fifty portugal together with such succour as be conduct by Paul prince of angola who be not long before convert discomfit more than a million of ethiopian in a other place we declare the ready mean and opportunity that the prince of Ethiopia and of India have to assemble and bring together such infinite army they say that certain ethiopian be demand by a Portugal how it come to pass that so great a multitude turn their back to so few man they answer that the portugal strength do it not which with a blast they will have confound but a woman of incomparable beauty apparel in shine light and brightness and a old man that keep her company with a flame sword in his hand who go aloft in the air before the portugal and overthrow the squadron of the Angolans put they to flight and destruction in the year 1588. be convert don Paulo prince of Mocumba and with he a thousand person more the christian religion of Monomotapa in the dominion of the Monomotapa the light of the faith be with incredible ease kindle be also as sudden (@) by the device of the mahometan for some portugal go to the court of that monarch and give himself with some of his prince and vassal a taste of the gospel be a occasion afterward that gonsaluo de Sylva a man no less famous for the integrity of his life then for his blood and parentage go over thither from goa in the year 1570. this man arrive with a prosperous voyage in the kingdom of Inambane convert and baptize the king his wife child and sister with his baron and nobility and the great part of his people through who persuasion gonsaluo leave his companion prosecute his voyage towards the Monomotapa only with six portugal thus have pass mozambique and the mouth of the river and of colimane they come to Mengoaxano king of Quiloa where they be courteous receivedand entertain and though they have licence in this place to preach the gospel yet will not gonsaluo here stay judge that upon the conversion of the Monomotapa that of the neighbour king will follow without delay embark themselves therefore upon the river Cuama they sail along the coast of Africa eight day till they come to Sena a very populous village where gonsaluo baptize about five hundred slave belong to the Portugal merchant and prepare for the receive of the gospel the king of inamor one of the monomotapaes vassal in the end Antonio Caiado a Portugal gentleman come from the court to guide gonsaluo towards the same place whither be in short time come he be present visit on the emperor behalf and bountiful present with a great sum of gold and many ox but he return back these present give the Monomotapa to understand that he shall know of Caiado what he desire the emperor be astonish at this his magnanimity and receive he afterward with the great honour that can possible be devise and cause he to sit upon the same carpet whereon also his own mother sit he present demand how many woman how much ground and how many ox thing mighty esteem of in those country he will have gonsaluo answer that he will have no other thing but himself whereupon the emperor turn to Caiado who be their interpreter say that sure it can not be otherwise but that he who make so little account of thing so high value by other be no ordinary man and so with much courtesy he send he back to his lodging not long time after the emperor let gonsaluo to understand that he and his mother be resolve to become christian and that therefore he shall come to baptize they but he to instruct they better in the faith defer it off for some day final five and twenty day after his arrival with unspeakable (@) and preparation he give the water of baptism to the king and to his mother he be call Sebastian and she maria. and present after about three hundred of the principal in this emperor court be baptize gonsaluo for his wonderful abstinence charity wisdom and for many other his singular virtue be so reverence and esteem by those people as if he have come down from heaven among they now as matter proceed thus prosperous and with so desirable success behold a horrible tempest arise which drown the ship there be in the court four mahometan most dear unto the king these man find out some occasion suggest unto he that gonsaluo be a magioian who by witchcraft and (@) can turn kingdom topsy-turvy and that he be come to pry into his estate and to stir up his people to rebellion and so by this mean to bring his kingdom under subjection to the portugal with these and such like suggestion they bring the king who be but a young man to determine the death of gonsaluo the effect whereof be that after long prayer repose himself a little he be by eight of the king servant slay and his body throw into the river near unto the same place be with like violence put to death fifty new-conuerted christian this rage and fury be over the king be advertise by the principal of his kingdom and then by the portugal of the excess and outrage he have therein commit he excuse himself the best he can cause those mahometan to be slay who have seduce he and he seek out some other also who lay hide to put they to death whereupon it seem that by the death of father gonsaluo the conversion of this great king and of his empire shall have be further and no whit hinder if the portugal will rather have prevail by the word of God then by force of arm the which I say because instead of send new preacher into those country to preserve that which be already get and to make new conversion they resolve to revenge themselves by war there depart therefore out of Portugal a good fleet with a great number of noble portugal therein conduct by Francisco Barretto at the fame of this war move against he the Monomotapa full of fear send to demand peace of Barretto but he aspire to the infinite mine of gold in that kingdom contemn all condition offer he the effect of this enterprise be that this army which be so terrible to a mighty monarch be in few day consume by the intemperature of the air which be there insupportable to the people of Europe of the fortress and colony maintain by the spaniard and portugal upon the main of Africa by mean whereof the christian religion have there some small foot which albeit in other respect they have be mention before yet here also in this one regard it seem not from our purpose brief to remember they to the propagation of Christianity those fortress and colony wonderful help which the castilian but much more the portugal have plant on the coast of Africa for they serve very fit either to convert infidel upon diverse occasion or by get a habit of their language and custom to make a more easy way to their conversion for those who be not sufficient to preach serve for interpreter to the preacher and thus God have oftentimes be well serve and with excellent fruit and effect by the endeavour of some soldier on the coast of Africa upon the Mediterran sea the spaniard have oran Mersalchibir Melilla etc. and the portugal Tanger and and without the straits of Gibraltar Arzilla and mazagan and in Ethiopia saint George they have also a settle habitation in the city of saint Saluador the metropolitan of the kingdom of congo and in Cumbiba a country of angola beyond the cape they hold the fortress and colony of Sena Cefala and Mozambiche here beside their secular clergy be a convent of dominican who endeavour themselves to instruct the portugal and the pagan also which there inhabit and do traffic thither of the island of the atlantic ocean where the spaniard and portugal have plant religion the christian name be also augment and do still increase in the atlantic ocean by mean of the colony conduct thither partly by the spaniard and partly by the portugal the spaniard undertake the enterprise of the canary in the year of our lord 1405. use therein the assistance of John Betancort a french gentleman who subdue Lancarota and Fuerteventura they be take again certain year after and be first subdue by force of arm and afterward by the establishment of religion so that at this present all the inhabitant be christian also the portugal have assay to inhabit certain other island of that ocean and especial madera which be discover in the year 1420. this at the first be all over a thick and mighty wood but now it be one of the best manure island that be know there be in the same the city of funcial be the seat of a bishop puerto santo which be forty mile distant from madera be find out in the year 1428. and this also begin present to be inhabit the isle of Arguin be six or seven and all but little one come to the knowledge of the portugal in the year 1443. here the king have a fortress for the traffic of those country the island of cabo Verde be discover in the year 1440. by Antonio Nolli a genoese or as other affirm in the year 1455. by Cadamosto these be nine in number the principal of they be Sant jago be seventy mile in length where the portugal have a town situate upon a most pleasant river call ribera which consist at (@) least of five hundred family the isle of saint Thomas be somewhat great than madera be the last island discover by the portugal before they double the cape Esperanca they have here a colony call Povasaon with a bishop who be also the bishop of congo and it contain seven hundred family under the government of saint Thomas be the neighbour island of Fernando Po and that which be as it be borough belong to the same the island Loanda though it be under the king of congo yet be a great part thereof inhabit by the portugal for here be the famous port of * * * * * * * * * not mazagan upon the coast of Barbary Mazagan whither the ship of Portugal and Brasile do resort here the fleet be harbour and the soldier refresh and here they have their hospital as also here the Portugal priest who endeavour the conversion of the natural inhabitant have a place of residence of the negro most of the island inhabit by the portugal especial those of saint Thomas and madera beside the portugal themselves contain a great multitude of negro-slave bring thither out of congo and angola who till the earth water the sugarcane and serve both in the city and in the country these be for the most part gentile but they be daily convert rather through continual conversation than any other help that they have and it be a matter likely that in process of some few year they will all become christian there be no great hindrance to their conversion than the avarice of their master who to hold they in the more subjection be not willing that they shall become christian of those poor distress european christian in Africa who be hold as slave unto the turk and moor but the best and most sincere christianity in all Africa be that of those poor christian who be fetter by the foot with chain be slave to the arabian and turk for beside they that have remain there ever since the day of Barbarossa and other turkish captain which be bring into the mediterran sea by the french as also since the great loss at Gerbi and the battle of Alcazar wherein don Sebastian the king of Portugal be overthrow there pass not a year but the rover and pirate of those part without grant any league or respite to the northern shore of the Mediterran sea take great number of christian from off the coast of Spain Sardinia Corsica Sicilia yea even from the very mouth of Tiber it be general think that the number of slave which be in alger amount to eighteen thousand in Tunis Bona and Biserta there be great multitude but many more in Fez and Maroco as likewise in Mequenez and Tarodant and in diverse other city of those kingdom the estate sure of these distress people be most worthy of compassion not so much for the misery wherein they lead their life as for the danger whereto their soul be subject they pass the day in continual travail and the great part of the night without repose or quiet under insupportable burden and cruel stripe beast among we labour not more nor be more slavish entreat yea albeit under those brutish barbarian they endure all that toil which beast do here with we yet be they neither so well feed nor so careful look unto as our beast common be they wear out the whole day in the sun rain and wind in continual labour sometime carry burden sometime dig or plough the field and otherwhiles in turn of hand-mille feed of beast or in performance of other labour be bind to bring in so much every day to their master and they themselves to live of the rest which many time be nothing at (@) or if it be possible less than nothing they have always the chain at their neck and foot be naked (@) and summer and therefore be sometime scorch with heat and otherwhiles freeze with cold they must not fail in any jot of their duty and yet though they do not it can not be express with what cruelty they be torment they use for the chastise and torture of their body chain of iron dry sinew of ox but-hoop steep in water boil oil melt tallow and scald hot lard the house of those barbarian resound again with the blow that be give these miserable man on the foot and belly and the prison be fill with hideous lamentation and yell their companion hair at this noise stand a end and their very blood freeze within they by consider how near themselves be to the like outrage they pass the night in prison or in some cave of the earth be hamper and yoke together like brute beast here the vapour and damp choke they and the uncleanness and filth of their lodging consume they as rust do iron even alive but though the labour of their body be so grievous yet those of their mind be much more intolerable for beside that they want such as may feed they with the word of God and with the sacrament and may teach they how to live and die well so as they remain like plant without moisture it can not be express with whatforcible temptation their faith be continual assail for not only the desire to come forth of these unspeakable misery do tempt they but the commodity and delight also wherein they see other to live that have damnable renounce their christianity the persecutor of the primitive church to induce the martyr to deny Christ and to sacrifice to their idol try they first with torment and then with ease and delight which they propound unto they if they will become as themselves for to those who in the midst of winter be throw into freeze lake there be contrariwise appoint soft and delicate bed with a fire kindle hard by and a thousand other restorative and comfort to the end they may be tempt both by the rigour of the cold which benumb they and by the sweetness of thing comfortable and nourish which allure they the christian slave be at this day no less torment for on the one side they be afflict with beggary nakedness hunger famine blow reproach and torture without any hope in a manner ever to come out thereof and on the other side they see they that have renege our holy faith for mahumets superstition to live in all worldly prosperity and delight to abound with wealth to flourish in honour to govern city to conduct army and to enjoy most ample liberty but amid all these so great misery they have a double comfort the one be of priest who together with themselves be take captive these man sometime administer the sacrament and other while deliver the word of God in the best manner that they can be some help and assistance to other be for this great (@) and respect among they the other be of the religious in general who contend and labour for their freedom wherein Spain deserve most high commendation for there be two most honourable order who exercise it be to move and solicit for the freedom of captive the one be call and it flourish most in Arragon and the other which be far great be name Del Resgate or of ransom or redemption the which although it large extend over all France yet at this day above all other place it be most rife in Castilia from whence some of they have go into Sicily to the kingdom of Naples and to Rome and have there begin to lay foundation of their convent these two religious order gather every year mighty sum of money wherewith they make speedy redemption of the foresay captive they send their agent to Fez and to alger who manage this affair with no less diligence than loyalty redeem first all the religious and priest and after they those of the young sort first the king of Spain subject and then other they always leave one religious man in alger and another in Fez who inform themselves of the state and quality of the slave with their necessity to make the better way for their liberty the year follow the king of Spain who it most concern further this so charitable a work with a bountiful and liberal hand for ordinary he give as much more as the foresay order have gather and collect by way of alm for this be so good a enterprise that by the ancient canon no other be so much favour and allow of yea s. Ambrose and other holy man have pawn for the delivery of christian captive the chalice and silver vessel of their church and saint Paulinus for the same end and purpose sell his own self for all other action of charity be some spiritual and other corporal but this in a very eminent degree be both spiritual and corporal together for among corporal misery the servitude of infidel be most grievous and among spiritual calamity the danger of apostasy be of all other the great but those slave so redeem be set free both from the one and from the other whereupon there be very few bear in Spain who die leave not some alm behind they for the ransom of slave the (@) of redemption have go also many time to Constantinople where in the year 1583. by the order of pope Gregory the thirteen they redeem five hundred person the brotherhood also of the Confalone in Rome labour very diligent in this point who in sixtus time redeem a great number of captive of who many also urge partly by the hardness of servitude and partly by the sweetness of liberty free themselves either by that which they gain over and above their master due or by their good demeanour or else by flight and they fly away sometime by repair speedy to such fortress as the king of Spain have in Africa and in Barbary and otherwhiles they seize on some ship or on the self same galley wherein they be chain many also retire themselves to the prince of Brisch etc. who willing receive and arm they use their assistance in the war which they continual make with the turk of alger
